author: Bruce Feirstein

quote: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Never do tomorrow what you can do today. Procrastination is the thief of time.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Opportunities don’t happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

quote: You can never cross the ocean until you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Christopher Columbus

quote: Don’t spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: The road to success and the road to failure are almost exactly the same.
author: Colin R. Davis

quote: There are far, far better things ahead than any we leave behind.
author: CS Lewis

quote: Remember that not getting what you want is sometimes a wonderful stroke of luck.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: People rarely succeed unless they have fun in what they are doing.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no help at all.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: A successful man is one who can lay a firm foundation with the bricks others have thrown at him.
author: David Brinkley

quote: The reason most people never reach their goals is that they don’t define them, or ever seriously consider them as believable or achievable. Winners can tell you where they are going, what they plan to do along the way, and who will be sharing the adventure with them.
author: Denis Watiley

quote: I don’t want to get to the end of my life and find that I lived just the length of it. I want to have lived the width of it as well.
author: Diane Ackerman

quote: Thinking should become your capital asset, no matter whatever ups and downs you come across in your life.
author: Dr. APJ Kalam

quote: Perfection is boring. Getting better is where all the fun is.
author: Dragos Roua

quote: We become what we think about most of the time, and that’s the strangest secret.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: There are two ways of spreading light. To be the candle, or the mirror that reflects it.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: There is no chance, no destiny, no fate, that can hinder or control the firm resolve of a determined soul.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: Build your own dreams, or someone else will hire you to build theirs.
author: Farrah Gray

quote: Our greatest fear should not be of failure but of succeeding at things in life that don’t really matter.
author: Francis Chan

quote: I don’t measure a man’s success by how high he climbs but how high he bounces when he hits bottom.
author: General George Patton

quote: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

quote: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Do not wait; the time will never be ‘just right.’ Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
author: George Herbert

quote: You’ve got to get up every morning with determination if you’re going to go to bed with satisfaction.
author: George Lorimer

quote: Your focus determines your reality.
author: George Lucas

quote: Press forward. Do not stop, do not linger in your journey, but strive for the mark set before you.
author: George Whitefield

quote: If you genuinely want something, don’t wait for it — teach yourself to be impatient.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stow

quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens, but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one that has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: It’s not what you look at that matters, it’s what you see.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The whole secret of a successful life is to find out what is one’s destiny to do, and then do it.
author: Henry Ford

quote: A man cannot build a reputation on what he is going to do.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Whether you think you can, or you can’t – either way you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

quote: A real entrepreneur is somebody who has no safety net underneath them.
author: Henry Kravis

quote: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
author: Herman Melville

quote: We do not need magic to transform our world. We carry all of the power we need inside ourselves already. We have the power to imagine better.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: A champion is someone who gets up when he can’t.
author: Jack Dempsey

quote: Limitations live only in our minds. But if we use our imaginations, our possibilities become limitless.
author: Jamie Paolinetti

quote: There is only one motivation, and that is desire. No reasons or principle contain it or stand against it.
author: Jane Smiley

quote: The work you do when you procrastinate is probably the work you should be doing for the rest of your life.
author: Jessica Hische

quote: If you are not willing to risk the usual you will have to settle for the ordinary.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: If you don’t design your own life plan, chances are you’ll fall into someone else’s plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Ryun

quote: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

quote: Success is…knowing your purpose in life, growing to reach your maximum potential, and sowing seeds that benefit others.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Sometimes you win, sometimes you learn.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: There are two kinds of people in this world; those who want to get things done, and those who don’t want to make mistakes.
author: John C. Maxwell

quote: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Don’t let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

quote: Things work out best for those who make the best of how things work out.
author: John Wooden

quote: Challenges are what make life interesting. Overcoming them is what makes life meaningful.
author: Joshua J Marine

quote: Running allows me to set my mind free. Nothing seems impossible. Nothing unattainable.
author: Kara Goucher

quote: One man can be a crucial ingredient on a team, but one man cannot make a team.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

quote: Why should you continue going after your dreams? Because seeing the look on the faces of the people who said you couldn’t… will be priceless.
author: Kevin Ngo

quote: If you don’t value your time, neither will others. Stop giving away your time and talents- start charging for it.
author: Kim Garst

quote: Make sure your worst enemy doesn’t live between your own two ears.
author: Laird Hamilton

quote: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo Da Vinci

quote: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

quote: The harder the battle, the sweeter the victory.
author: Les Brown

quote: Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: Lolly Daskal

quote: Every now and then it’s good to stop climbing and appreciate the view from right where you are.
author: Lori Deschene

quote: Always remember that you are absolutely unique; just like everone else.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: You may have to fight a battle more than once to win it.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
author: Marianne Williamson

quote: If you have everything under control, you’re not moving fast enough.
author: Mario Andretti

quote: Be strong enough to stand alone, smart enough to know when you need help, and brave enough to ask for it.
author: Mark Amend

quote: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
author: Mark Caine

quote: Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn’t do than by the ones you did do, so throw off the bowlines, sail away from safe harbor, catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore, Dream, Discover.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear – not absense of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I find that when you have a real interest in life and a curious life, that sleep is not the most important thing.
author: Martha Stewart

quote: You don’t have to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr

quote: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is a quiet voice at the end of the day saying, ‘I will try again tomorrow.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

quote: The only person you should try to be better than, is the person you were yesterday.
author: Matty Mullens

quote: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: There is no agony like bearing an untold story inside of you.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: All progress takes place outside the comfort zone.
author: Michael John Bobak

quote: I’ve missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: You must expect great things of yourself before you can do them.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Obstacles don’t have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don’t turn around and give up.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
author: Michael Korda

quote: There will be obstacles. There will be doubters. There will be mistakes. But with hard work, there are no limits.
author: Michael Phelps

quote: You can’t put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the further you get.
author: Michael Phelps

quote: To be successful you must accept all challenges that come your way. You can’t just accept the ones you like.
author: Mike Gafka

quote: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as long as we live.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the water to create many ripples.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: It isn’t the mountains ahead to climb that wear you out; it’s the pebble in your shoe.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: The starting point of all achievement is desire.
author: Napolean Hill

quote: Whatever the mind of man can conceive and believe, it can achieve.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: The number one reason people fail in life is because they listen to their friends, family, and neighbors.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: Believe in yourself! Have faith in your abilities! Without a humble but reasonable confidence in your own powers you cannot be successful or happy.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: If you look at what you have in life, you’ll always have more. If you look at what you don’t have in life, you’ll never have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Do what you have to do until you can do what you want to do.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: More powerful than the will to win is the courage to begin.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: Find a victory in every defeat to remain hopeful, and find a defeat in every victory to remain humble.
author: Orrin Woodward

quote: What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people just exist.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Only put off until tomorrow what you are willing to die having left undone.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Learn the rules like a pro so you can break them like an artist.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: There are only two options regarding commitment. You’re either in or you’re out. There is no such thing as life in-between.
author: Pat Riley

quote: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.
author: Pauline Kael

quote: When we strive to become better than we are, everything around us becomes better too.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: The more difficult the victory, the greater the happiness in winning.
author: Pele

quote: You may only succeed if you desire succeeding; you may only fail if you do not mind failing.
author: Philippos

quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

quote: Just when the caterpillar thought the world was ending, he turned into a butterfly.
author: Proverb

quote: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Don’t be pushed by your problems; be led by your dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: There are two types of people who will tell you that you cannot make a difference in this world: those who are afraid to try and those who are afraid you will succeed.
author: Ray Goforth

quote: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day-in and day-out.
author: Robert Collier

quote: You don’t drown by falling in water; you drown by staying there.
author: Robert Collier

quote: Don’t let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
author: Robert Kiyosaki

quote: Don’t judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Better to do something imperfectly than to do nothing flawlessly.
author: Robert Schuller

quote: Don’t live the same year 75 times and call it a life.
author: Robin Sharma

quote: We can’t help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: Do it with passion, or not at all.
author: Rosa Nouchette Carey

quote: I have learned over the years that when one’s mind is made up, this diminishes fear.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: If you’re offered a seat on a rocket ship, don’t ask what seat! Just get on.
author: Sheryl Sandberg

quote: Change your life today. Don’t gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Speak only if you can improve the silence.
author: Spanish proverb

quote: I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.
author: Stephen Covey

quote: Work gives you meaning and purpose, and life is empty without it.
author: Stephen Hawking

quote: Motivation is a fire from within. If someone else tries to light that fire under you, chances are it will burn very briefly.
author: Stephen R Covey

quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: You can’t connect the dots looking forward; you can only connect them looking backwards. So you have to trust that the dots will somehow connect in your future. You have to trust in something – your gut, destiny, life, karma, whatever. This approach has never let me down, and it has made all the difference in my life.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: When everything’s coming your way, you’re in the wrong lane.
author: Steven Wright

quote: Don’t downgrade your dream just to fit your reality. Upgrade your conviction to match your destiny.
author: Stuart Scott

quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life – think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: If you want to make a permanent change, stop focusing on the size of your problems and start focusing on the size of you!
author: T. Harv Eker

quote: When you’ve got something to prove, there’s nothing greater than a challenge.
author: Terry Bradshaw

quote: Real difficulties can be overcome; it is only the imaginary ones that are unconquerable.
author: Theodore N. Vail

quote: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Believe you can and you’re halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas Edison

quote: Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: If you want to achieve excellence, you can get there today. As of this second, quit doing less-than-excellent work.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: If you want something you’ve never had, you must be willing to do something you’ve never done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person’s determination.
author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: People who succeed have momentum. The more they succeed, the more they want to succeed, and the more they find a way to succeed. Similarly, when someone is failing, the tendency is to get on a downward spiral that can even become a self-fulfilling prophecy.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: The individual who says it is not possible should get out of the way of those doing it.
author: Tricia Cunningham

quote: Failure is the condiment that gives success its flavor.
author: Truman Capote

quote: A comfort zone is a beautiful place, but nothing ever grows there.
author: Unknown

quote: Throw me to the wolves and I will return leading the pack.
author: Unknown

quote: The 3 C’s in life: Choice, chance, change. You must make the choice, to take the chance, if you want anything in life to change.
author: Unknown

quote: There are better starters than me, but I’m a strong finisher.
author: Usain Bolt

quote: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

quote: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: A man can be as great as he wants to be. If you believe in yourself and have the courage, the determination, the dedication, the competitive drive and if you are willing to sacrifice the little things in life and pay the price for the things that are worthwhile, it can be done.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The quality of a person’s life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: I would rather die of passion than of boredom.
author: Vincent van Gogh

quote: Fortune sides with him who dares.
author: Virgil

quote: Aim for the moon. If you miss, you may hit a star.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: All our dreams can come true if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You must not let anyone define your limits because of where you come from. Your only limit is your soul.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above it.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it’s always your choice.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: If you’re going through hell keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Do or do not. There is no try.
author: Yoda

quote: People often say that motivation doesn’t last. Well, neither does bathing – that’s why we recommend it daily.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: What you discover on your own is always more exciting than what someone else discovers for you – it’s like the marriage between romantic love and an arranged marriage.
author: Terrence Rafferty

quote: Just when I think I have learned the way to live, life changes.
author: Hugh Prather

quote: It’s a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Man never knows what he wants; he aspires to penetrate mysteries and as soon as he has, he wants to reestablish them. Ignorance irritates him and knowledge cloys.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: The man who views the world at fifty the same as he did at twenty has wasted thirty years of his life.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

quote: People often say that this or that person has not yet found himself. But the self is not something one finds, it is something one creates.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: If you don’t get lost, there’s a chance you may never be found.
author: Anonymous

quote: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

quote: You will recognize your own path when you come upon it, because you will suddenly have all the energy and imagination you will ever need.
author: Jerry Gillies

quote: There is only one corner of the universe you can be certain of improving, and that’s your own self.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The greatest explorer on this earth never takes voyages as long as those of the man who descends to the depth of his heart.
author: Julien Green

quote: A man’s growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Man can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as… from a lack of bread.
author: Richard Wright, Native Son, 1940

quote: Why should we honour those that die upon the field of battle? A man may show as reckless a courage in entering into the abyss of himself.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: For most men life is a search for the proper manila envelope in which to get themselves filed.
author: Clifton Fadiman

quote: Know yourself. Don’t accept your dog’s admiration as conclusive evidence that you are wonderful.
author: Ann Landers

quote: I can teach anybody how to get what they want out of life. The problem is that I can’t find anybody who can tell me what they want.
author: Mark Twain

quote: ‘Know thyself?’ If I knew myself, I’d run away.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Like an old gold-panning prospector, you must resign yourself to digging up a lot of sand from which you will later patiently wash out a few minute particles of gold ore.
author: Dorothy Bryant

quote: It is the individual who knows how little they know about themselves who stands the most reasonable chance of finding out something about themselves before they die.
author: S. I. Hayakawa

quote: There is no satisfaction that can compare with looking back across the years and finding you’ve grown in self-control, judgment, generosity, and unselfishness.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: There are three things extremely hard: steel, a diamond, and to know one’s self.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The longer I love, the more beautiful life becomes. If you foolishly ignore beauty, you will soon find yourself without it.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The searching-out and thorough investigation of truth ought to be the primary study of man.
author: Cicero

quote: I know well what I am fleeing from but not what I am in search of.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: I think somehow we learn who we really are and then we live with that decision.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The only journey is the journey within.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: All men should strive to learn before they die what they are running from, and to, and why.
author: James Thurber

quote: Man can starve from a lack of self-realization as much as… from a lack of bread.
author: Richard Wright

quote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars, and they pass by themselves without wondering.
author: St. Augustine

quote: We only become what we are by the radical and deep-seated refusal of that which others have made of us.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself one.
author: James A. Froude

quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
author: George Moore

quote: Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: There are… things which a man is afraid to tell even to himself, and every decent man has a number of such things stored away in his mind.” – Fyodor Dostoyevsky, “Notes from the Underground,
One must know oneself. If this does not serve to discover truth, it at least serves as a rule of life and there is nothing better.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: If you resist reading what you disagree with, how will you ever acquire deeper insights into what you believe? The things most worth reading are precisely those that challenge our convictions.
author: Anonymous

quote: Becoming conscious is of course a sacrilege against nature; it is as though you had robbed the unconscious of something.
author: Carl G. Jung

quote: The well bred contradict other people. The wise contradict themselves.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Your work is to discover your world and then with all your heart give yourself to it.
author: Buddha

quote: All wonders you seek are within yourself.
author: Sir Thomas Browne

quote: One’s own self is well hidden from one’s own self; of all mines of treasure, one’s own is the last to be dug up.
author: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quote: One was a book I read by Mahatma Gandhi. In it was a passage where he said that religion, the pursuing of the inner journey, should not be separated from the pursuing of the outer and social journey, because we are not isolated beings.
author: Satish Kumar

quote: A man who finds no satisfaction in himself will seek for it in vain elsewhere.
author: La Rochefoucauld

quote: It is not only the most difficult thing to know oneself, but the most inconvenient one, too.
author: H.W. Shaw

quote: Painting is self-discovery. Every good artist paints what he is.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: Resolve to be thyself; and know that he who finds himself, loses his misery.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: They will only care when you’re gone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: In Hollywood a girl’s virtue is much less important than her hairdo. You’re judged by how you look, not by what you are. Hollywood’s a place where they’ll pay you a thousand dollars for kiss, and fifty cents for your soul. I know, because I turned down the first offer often enough and held out for the fifty.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m very definitely a woman and I enjoy it.
author: Unknown

quote: Everybody is always tugging at you. They’d all like a sort of chunk out of you. I don’t think they realize it, but it’s like ‘grrr do this, grr do that…’But you do want to stay intact and on two feet.
author: Unknown

quote: I have feelings too. I am still human. All I want is to be loved, for myself and for my talent.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A woman can’t be alone. She needs a man. A man and a woman support and strengthen each other. She just can’t do it by herself.
author: Unknown

quote: I always felt insecure and in the way, but most of all I felt scared. I guess I wanted love more than anything else in the world.
author: Unknown

quote: If I’m a star, then the people made me a star.
author: Unknown

quote: Creativity has got to start with humanity and when you’re a human being, you feel, you suffer.
author: Unknown

quote: Success makes so many people hate you. I wish it wasn’t that way. It would be wonderful to enjoy success without seeing envy in the eyes of those around you.
author: Unknown

quote: One of the best things that ever happened to me is that I’m a woman. That is the way all females should feel.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Fame will go by and, so long, I’ve had you, Fame. If it goes by, I’ve always known it was fickle.
author: Unknown

quote: The most unsatisfactory men are those who pride themselves on their virility and regard sex as if it were some form of athletics at which you can win cups. It is a woman’s spirit and mood a man has to stimulate in order to make sex interesting. The real lover is the man who can thrill you just by touching your head or smiling into your eyes or by just staring into space.
author: Unknown

quote: First, I’m trying to prove to myself that I’m a person. Then maybe I’ll convince myself that I’m an actress.
author: Unknown

quote: This life is what you make it. No matter what, you’re going to mess up sometimes, it’s a universal truth. But the good part is you get to decide how you’re going to mess it up.
author: Unknown

quote: With fame, you know, you can read about yourself, somebody else’s ideas about you, but what’s important is how you feel about yourself – for survival and living day to day with what comes up.
author: Unknown

quote: We are all of us stars, and we deserve to twinkle.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I want to grow old without facelifts… I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I’ve made. Sometimes I think it would be easier to avoid old age, to die young, but then you’d never complete your life, would you? You’d never wholly know you.
author: Unknown

quote: Arthur Miller wouldn’t have married me if I had been nothing but a dumb blonde.
author: Unknown

quote: No one ever told me I was pretty when I was a little girl. All little girls should be told they’re pretty, even if they aren’t.
author: Unknown

quote: I think that when you are famous every weakness is exaggerated.
author: Unknown

quote: Respect is one of life’s greatest treasures. I mean, what does it all add up to if you don’t have that?
author: Unknown

quote: The nicest thing for me is sleep, then at least I can dream.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I won’t be satisfied until people want to hear me sing without looking at me. Of course, that doesn’t mean I want them to stop looking.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m one of the world’s most self-conscious people. I really have to struggle.
author: Unknown

quote: Fame is fickle, and I know it. It has its compensations but it also has its drawbacks, and I’ve experienced them both.
author: Unknown

quote: Sometimes I feel my whole life has been one big rejection.
author: Unknown

quote: I think that sexuality is only attractive when it’s natural and spontaneous.
author: Unknown

quote: I restore myself when I’m alone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A man is more frank and sincere with his emotions than a woman. We girls, I’m afraid, have a tendency to hide our feelings.
author: Unknown

quote: My work is the only ground I’ve ever had to stand on. I seem to have a whole superstructure with no foundation but I’m working on the foundation.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m one of the world’s most self-conscious people. I really have to struggle.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t consider myself an intellectual. And this is not one of my aims. But I admire intellectual people.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m a failure as a woman. My men expect so much of me, because of the image they’ve made of me– and that I’ve made of myself– as a sex symbol. They expect bells to ring and whistles to whistle, but my anatomy is the same as any other woman’s and I can’t live up to it.
author: Unknown

quote: Fame doesn’t fulfill you. It warms you a bit, but that warmth is temporary.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A wise girl kisses but doesn’t love, listens but doesn’t believe, and leaves before she is left.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t mind living in a man’s world, as long as I can be a woman in it.
author: Unknown

quote: If I play a stupid girl and ask a stupid question, I’ve got to follow it through, what am I supposed to do, look intelligent?
author: Unknown

quote: It’s far better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone — so far.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t know who invented high heels, but all women owe him a lot!
author: Unknown

quote: She was a girl who knew how to be happy even when she was sad. And that’s important—you know.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Before marriage, a girl has to make love to a man to hold him. After marriage, she has to hold him to make love to him.
author: Unknown

quote: If you’re gonna be two-faced at least make one of them pretty.
author: Unknown

quote: I’ve never fooled anyone. I’ve let people fool themselves. They didn’t bother to find out who and what I was. Instead they would invent a character for me. I wouldn’t argue with them. They were obviously loving somebody I wasn’t.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s not true that I had nothing on. I had the radio on.
author: Unknown

quote: I love to do the things the censors won’t pass.
author: Unknown

quote: I’ve been on a calendar, but never on time.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: When it comes down to it, I let them think what they want. If they care enough to bother with what I do, then I’m already better than them.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t mind making jokes, but I don’t want to look like one.
author: Unknown

quote: I knew I belonged to the public and to the world, not because I was talented or even beautiful, but because I had never belonged to anything or anyone else.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s often just enough to be with someone. I don’t need to touch them. Not even talk. A feeling passes between you both. You’re not alone.
author: Unknown

quote: Dogs never bite me. Just humans.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t understand why people aren’t a little more generous with each other.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: In spite of everything life is not without hope.
author: Unknown

quote: A girl doesn’t need anyone that doesn’t need her.
author: Unknown

quote: The body is meant to be seen, not all covered up.
author: Unknown

quote: All we demanded was our right to twinkle.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t mind being burdened with being glamorous and sexual. Beauty and femininity are ageless and can’t be contrived, and glamour, although the manufacturers won’t like this, cannot be manufactured. Not real glamour; it’s based on femininity.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t want to make money. I just want to be wonderful.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I don’t stop when I’m tired. I only stop when I’m done.
author: Unknown

quote: All a girl really wants is for one guy to prove to her that they are not all the same.
author: Unknown

quote: Ever notice how ‘What the hell’ is always the right answer?
author: Unknown

quote: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
author: Unknown

quote: How wrong it is for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself.
author: Unknown

quote: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there’s so much to smile about.
author: Unknown

quote: A career is wonderful, but you can’t curl up to it on a cold night.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: What do I wear in bed? Why, Chanel No. 5, of course.
author: Unknown

quote: Boys think girls are like books, If the cover doesn’t catch their eye they won’t bother to read what’s inside.
author: Unknown

quote: Just because you fail once doesn’t mean you’re gonna fail at everything.
author: Unknown

quote: Who said nights were for sleep?
author: Unknown

quote: It’s all make believe, isn’t it?
author: Unknown

quote: Dreaming about being an actress, is more exciting then being one.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I read poetry to save time.
author: Unknown

quote: You might as well make yourself fly as to make yourself love.
author: Unknown

quote: That’s the way you feel when you’re beaten inside. You don’t feel angry at those who’ve beaten you. You just feel ashamed.
author: Unknown

quote: Always remember to smile and look up at what you got in life.
author: Unknown

quote: Looking back, I guess I used to play-act all the time. For one thing, it meant I could live in a more interesting world than the one around me.
author: Unknown

quote: I am trying to find myself. Sometimes that’s not easy.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Maybe I’ll never be able to do what I hope to, but at least I have hope.
author: Unknown

quote: Men are always ready to respect anything that bores them.
author: Unknown

quote: I’ve often stood silent at a party for hours listening to my movie idols turn into dull and little people.
author: Unknown

quote: I am not a victim of emotional conflicts. I am human.
author: Unknown

quote: If I’d observed all the rules I’d never have got anywhere.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: People had a habit of looking at me as if I were some kind of mirror instead of a person. They didn’t see me, they saw their own lewd thoughts, then they white-masked themselves by calling me the lewd one.
author: Unknown

quote: Millions of people live their entire lives without finding themselves. But it is something I must do.
author: Unknown

quote: For those who are poor in happiness, each time is a first time; happiness never becomes a habit.
author: Unknown

quote: Most men judge your importance in their lives by how much you can hurt them.
author: Unknown

quote: I live to succeed, not to please you or anyone else.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I don’t forgive people because I’m weak, I forgive them because I am strong enough to know people make mistakes.
author: Unknown

quote: Please quote me right!
author: Unknown

quote: The ‘public’ scares me, but people I trust.
author: Unknown

quote: I have always been deeply terrified to really be someone’s wife since I know from life one cannot love another, ever, really.
author: Unknown

quote: Beneath the makeup and behind the smile I am just a girl who wishes for the world.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Anything’s possible, almost.
author: Unknown

quote: This is supposed to be an art form, not just a manufacturing establishment. The sensitivity that helps me to act, you see, also makes me react. An actor is supposed to be a sensitive instrument.
author: Unknown

quote: I never wanted to be Marilyn — it just happened. Marilyn’s like a veil I wear over Norma Jeane.
author: Unknown

quote: Its not too much fun to know yourself too well or think you do — everyone needs a little conceit to carry them through and past the falls.
author: Unknown

quote: You never know what life is like, until you have lived it.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: This is a free and democratic country and no one has a monopoly on anything.
author: Unknown

quote: For life: it is rather a determination not to be overwhelmed. For work: the truth can only be recalled, never invented.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m trying to find the nailhead, not just strike the blow.
author: Unknown

quote: Men are climbing to the moon, but they don’t seem interested in the beating human heart.
author: Unknown

quote: If you can make a woman laugh, you can make her do anything.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: It takes a smart brunette to play a dumb blonde.
author: Unknown

quote: Acting isn’t something you do. Instead of doing it, it occurs. If you’re going to start with logic, you might as well give up. You can have conscious preparation, but you have unconscious results.
author: Unknown

quote: I love a natural look in pictures. I like people with a feeling one way or another — it shows an inner life. I like to see that there’s something going on inside them.
author: Unknown

quote: We should all start to live before we get too old. Fear is stupid. So are regrets.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: She’d come out of our apartment in a shleppy old coat, looking like my maid, and all the people would push her aside to get my autograph. She loved it.
author: Shelley Winters

quote: I was very, very drawn to her. To me, she was like a golden child. She radiated light and vulnerability. She used to gravitate to me at parties because she knew I was not very secure either. She was fragile. I was very touched by her.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: She was trying to prove she was a serious actress and not just a movie star playing bimbo parts,” said Murray, who earned an Oscar nomination as Beau. “She was trying to prove she was an actress of substance, and in my opinion she certainly did.
author: ” -Don Murray

quote: I never saw anybody work so hard, but it wasn’t an easy ride. She did such a good job and personally, I think she stole the whole damn show. I just think she was thrown into a nest of vipers.
author: Mitzi Gaynor

quote: We must accept finite disappointment, but we must never lose infinite hope.
author: Martin Luther King

quote: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey.
author: Kenji Miyazawa

quote: Fall seven times, stand up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: We should always pray for help, but we should always listen for inspiration and impression to proceed in ways different from those we may have thought of.
author: John H. Groberg

quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trials.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Obstacles don’t have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don’t turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it. Skillful pilots gain their reputation from storms and tempests.
author: Epicetus

quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert Schuller

quote: Prosperity is a great teacher; adversity is a greater. Possession pampers the mind; privation trains and strengthens it.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Prosperity is not without many fears and disasters; and adversity is not without comforts and hopes.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don’t pray when it rains if you don’t pray when the sun shines.
author: Leroy Satchel Paige

quote: The difference between stumbling blocks and stepping stones is how you use them.
author: Unknown

quote: Next to trying and winning, the best thing is trying and failing.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: Just as despair can come to one only from other human beings, hope, too, can be given to one only by other human beings.
author: Elie Weisel

quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never failing, but in rising every time we fail.
author: Nelson Mandela

quote: In times of great stress or adversity, it’s always best to keep busy, to plow your anger and your energy into something positive.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: It is only in our darkest hours that we may discover the true strength of the brilliant light within ourselves that can never, ever, be dimmed.
author: Doe Zantamata

quote: Tough times never last, but tough people do.
author: Robert H Schuller

quote: If it’s not exactly like you thought it would be, you think it’s a failure. What about the spectrum of colors in between.
author: Sara Evans

quote: Use what you’ve been through as fuel, believe in yourself and be unstoppable!
author: Yvonne Pierre

quote: I learned there are troubles of more than one kind. Some come from ahead, others come from behind. But I’ve bought a big bat. I’m all ready, you see. Now my troubles are going to have trouble with me.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: In three words I can sum up everything I’ve learned about life. It goes on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Prosperity makes friends, adversity tries them.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Every adversity, every failure and every heartache carries with it the seed of an equivalent or a greater benefit.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: If you don’t like something change it; if you can’t change it, change the way you think about it.
author: Mary Engelbreit

quote: Courage doesn’t always roar. Sometimes courage is the quiet voice at the end of the day, saying, “I will try again tomorrow.
author: Mary Anne Radmacher

quote: Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact.
author: William James

quote: Have great hopes and dare to go all out for them. Have great dreams and dare to live them. Have tremendous expectations and believe in them.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: Things turn out the best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
author: John Wooden

quote: The best way to get rid of the pain is to feel the pain. And when you feel the pain and go beyond it, you’ll see there’s a very intense love that is wanting to awaken itself.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: To have darkness behind me, in front of me a bright sky, flickering lights on the water and to feel it on the stony face of the southern sun.
author: Julia Hartwig

quote: Even if happiness forgets you a little bit, never completely forget about it.
author: Jacques Prevert

quote: Man is fond of counting his troubles but he does not count his joys. If he counted them up, as he ought to, he would see that every lot has enough happiness provided for it.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: It doesn’t matter how slow you go, as long as you don’t stop.
author: Confucius

quote: Learn how to be happy with what you have while you pursue all that you want.
author: Jim rohn

quote: You are today where your thoughts have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your thoughts take you.
author: James Allen

quote: To succeed, you have to do something and be very bad at it for a while. You have to look bad before you can look really good.
author: Barbara DeAngelis

quote: The bravest sight in the world is to see a great man struggling against adversity.
author: Seneca

quote: I ask not for a lighter burden, but for broader shoulders.
author: Jewish Proverb

quote: When things are bad, we take comfort in the thought that they could always get worse. And when they are, we find hope in the thought that things are so bad they have to get better.
author: Malcolm S. Forbes

quote: He knows not his own strength who hath not met adversity.
author: William Samuel Johnson

quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness for it shows me the stars.
author: Og Mandino

quote: Girls will be your friends – they’ll act like it anyway. But just remember, some come, some go. The ones that stay with you through everything – they’re your true best friends.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: You can kid the world, but not your sister.
author: Charlotte Gray

quote: We hang out, we help one another, we tell one another our worst fears and biggest secrets, and then just like real sisters, we listen and don’t judge.
author: Adriana Trigiani

quote: Having a sister is like having a best friend you can’t get rid of.  You know whatever you do, they’ll still be there.
author: Amy Li

quote: If you have a sister and she dies, do you stop saying you have one? Or are you always a sister, even when the other half of the equation is gone?
author: Jodi Picoult

quote: Sisters, as you know, also have a unique relationship. This is the person who has known you your entire life, who should love you and stand by you no matter what, and yet it’s your sister who knows exactly where to drive the knife to hurt you the most.
author: Lisa See

quote: Sisters function as safety nets in a chaotic world simply by being there for each other.
author: Carol Saline

quote: How the hell do you sum up your sister in three minutes? She’s your twin and your polar opposite. She’s your constant companion and your competition. She’s your best friend and the biggest bitch in the world. She’s everything you wish you could be and everything you wish you weren’t.
author: M. Molly Backes

quote: My sister and I are so close that we finish each other’s sentences and often wonder who’s memories belong to whom.
author: Shannon Celebi

quote: Is solace anywhere more comforting than in the arms of a sister.
author: Alice Walker

quote: Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet.
author: Vietnamese Proverb

quote: A sister can be seen as someone who is both ourselves and very much not ourselves – a special kind of double.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: …she’ll go and fall in love, and there’s an end of peace and fun, and cozy times together.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: The first-born in every family is always dreaming for an imaginary older brother or sister who will look out for them.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: A sister is both your mirror – and your opposite.
author: Elizabeth Fishel

quote: That’s the best thing about little sisters: They spend so much time wishing they were elder sisters that in the end they’re far wiser than the elder ones could ever be.
author: Gemma Gurgess

quote: Children of the same family, the same blood, with the same first associations and habits, have some means of enjoyment in their power, which no subsequent connections can supply.
author: Jane Austen

quote: A sister smiles when one tells one’s stories – for she knows where the decoration has been added.
author: Chris Montaigne

quote: There can be no situation in life in which the conversation of my dear sister will not administer some comfort to me.
author: Mary Montagu

quote: You may be as different as the sun and the moon, but the same blood flows through both your hearts. You need her, as she needs you..
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: You’re a big sister?’ I was shocked. She seemed so good-natured and compassionate.
author: Natalie Standiford

quote: I would like more sisters, that the taking out of one, might not leave such stillness..
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: It was nice to be in such close physical proximity, even though they hadn’t spoken in months, and only via cursory birthday cards and the like. In the end, it didn’t matter. Sisters were sisters.
author: Emma Straub

quote: I know my older sister loves me because she gives me all her old clothes and has to go out and buy new ones.
author: Unknown

quote: When sisters stand shoulder to shoulder, who stands a chance against us?
author: Pam Brown

quote: Sisterly love is, of all sentiments, the most abstract.  Nature does not grant it any functions.
author: Ugo Betti

quote: When mom and dad don’t understand, a sister always will.
author: Unknown

quote: The best thing about having a sister was that I always had a friend.
author: Cali Rae Turner

quote: Our brothers and sisters are there with us from the dawn of our personal stories to the inevitable dusk.
author: Susan Scarf Merrell

quote: What’s the good of news if you haven’t a sister to share it?
author: James DeVries

quote: My sister taught me everything I really need to know, and she was only in sixth grade at the time.
author: Linda Sunshine

quote: An older sister helps one remain half child, half woman.
author: Unknown

quote: A sister is a forever friend.
author: Unknown

quote: Elder sisters never can do younger ones justice!
author: Charlotte M. Yonge

quote: If your sister is in a tearing hurry to go out and cannot catch your eye, she’s wearing your best sweater.
author: Pam Brown

quote: I, who have no sisters or brothers, look with some degree of innocent envy on those who may be said to be born to friends.
author: James Boswell

quote: Our roots say we’re sisters, our hearts say we’re friends.
author: Unknown

quote: Don’t believe an accident of birth makes people sisters or brothers. It makes them siblings, gives them mutuality of parentage. Sisterhood and brotherhood is a condition people have to work at.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: A sibling may be the keeper of one’s identity, the only person with the keys to one’s unfettered, more fundamental self.
author: Marian Sandmaier

quote: A sister is a gift to the heart, a friend to the spirit, a golden thread to the meaning of life.
author: Isadora James

quote: How do people make it through life without a sister?
author: Sara Corpening

quote: Siblings are the people we practice on, the people who teach us about fairness and cooperation and kindness and caring – quite often the hard way.
author: Pamela Dugdale

quote: We acquire friends and we make enemies, but our sisters come with the territory.
author: Evelyn Loeb

quote: Sisters may share the same mother and father but appear to come from different families.
author: Unknown

quote: An older sister is a friend and defender – a listener, conspirator, a counsellor and a sharer of delights. And sorrows too.
author: Pam Brown

quote: I know some sisters who only see each other on Mother’s Day and some who will never speak again. But most are like my sister and me… linked by volatile love, best friends who make other best friends ever so slightly less best.
author: Patricia Volk

quote: If you don’t understand how a woman could both love her sister dearly and want to wring her neck at the same time, then you were probably an only child.
author: Linda Sunshine

quote: Our siblings push buttons that cast us in roles we felt sure we had let go of long ago – the baby, the peacekeeper, the caretaker, the avoider…. It doesn’t seem to matter how much time has elapsed or how far we’ve traveled.
author: Jane Mersky Leder

quote: There is no better friend than a sister.  And there is no better sister than you.
author: Unknown

quote: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: We all live with the objective of being happy; our lives are all different and yet the same.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: You don’t develop courage by being happy in your relationships everyday. You develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
author: Epicurus

quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Most people would rather be certain they’re miserable, than risk being happy.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: The fact is always obvious much too late, but the most singular difference between happiness and joy is that happiness is a solid and joy a liquid.
author: J.D. Salinger

quote: There are two ways of being happy: We must either diminish our wants or augment our means – either may do – the result is the same and it is for each man to decide for himself and to do that which happens to be easier.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: If a person’s basic state of mind is serene and calm, then it is possible for this inner peace to overwhelm a painful physical experience. On the other hand, if someone is suffering from depression, anxiety, or any form of emotional distress, then even if he or she happens to be enjoying physical comforts, he will not really be able to experience the happiness that these could bring.
author: Tenzin Gyatso, 14th Dalai Lama

quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: No one is in control of your happiness but you; therefore, you have the power to change anything about yourself or your life that you want to change.
author: Barbara DeAngelis

quote: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.
author: W.P. Kinsella

quote: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man is fond of counting his troubles, but he does not count his joys.  If he counted them up as he ought to, he would see that every lot has enough happiness provided for it.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Too often in life, something happens and we blame other people for us not being happy or satisfied or fulfilled. So the point is, we all have choices, and we make the choice to accept people or situations or to not accept situations.
author: Tom Brady

quote: Indeed, man wishes to be happy even when he so lives as to make happiness impossible.
author: St. Augustine

quote: The Constitution only guarantees the American people the right to pursue happiness.  You have to catch it yourself.
author: Author unknown, commonly attributed to Benjamin Franklin

quote: Can anything be so elegant as to have few wants, and to serve them one’s self?
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The habit of being happy enables one to be freed, or largely freed, from the domination of outward conditions.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: If only we’d stop trying to be happy we could have a pretty good time.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Happiness is like a butterfly which, when pursued, is always beyond our grasp, but, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Most folks are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Happiness is a state of activity.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin Roosevelt

quote: A truly happy person is one who can enjoy the scenery while on a detour.
author: Author Unknown

quote: If you want others to be happy, practice compassion.  If you want to be happy, practice compassion.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Just as a cautious businessman avoids investing all his capital in one concern, so wisdom would probably admonish us also not to anticipate all our happiness from one quarter alone.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The only way to avoid being miserable is not to have enough leisure to wonder whether you are happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: If there were in the world today any large number of people who desired their own happiness more than they desired the unhappiness of others, we could have a paradise in a few years.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: When neither their property nor their honor is touched, the majority of men live content.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: We have no more right to consume happiness without producing it than to consume wealth without producing it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: One joy scatters a hundred griefs.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Unquestionably, it is possible to do without happiness; it is done involuntarily by nineteen-twentieths of mankind.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: When a man has lost all happiness, he’s not alive.  Call him a breathing corpse.
author: Sophocles

quote: Happiness consists more in conveniences of pleasure that occur everyday than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Happiness is your dentist telling you it won’t hurt and then having him catch his hand in the drill.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better to take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.
author: Carl Jung

quote: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It isn’t what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Learn to let go. That is the key to happiness.
author: Buddha

quote: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: If you want happiness for an hour – take a nap. If you want happiness for a day – go fishing. If you want happiness for a month – get married. If you want happiness for a year – inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime – help someone else.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance, the wise grows it under his feet.
author: James Oppenheim

quote: Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Our capacity to draw happiness from aesthetic objects or material goods in fact seems critically dependent on our first satisfying a more important range of emotional or psychological needs, among them the need for understanding, for love, expression and respect.
author: Alain De Botton

quote: Be happy with what you have. Be excited about what you want.
author: Alan Cohen

quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: I have only two kinds of days: happy and hysterically happy.
author: Allen J. Lefferdink

quote: People should find happiness in the little things, like family.
author: Amanda Bynes

quote: If you want to be happy, set a goal that commands your thoughts, liberates your energy, and inspires your hopes.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: As people spin faster and faster in the pursuit of merely personal happiness, they become exhausted in the futile effort of chasing themselves.
author: Andrew Delbanco

quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happy girls are the prettiest.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Learn to value yourself, which means: fight for your happiness.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Family, friends, a good laugh and beautiful weather are the best cures.
author: Bar Refaeli

quote: All happiness or unhappiness solely depends upon the quality of the object to which we are attached by love.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Happiness consists more in conveniences of pleasure that occur everyday than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
author: Bernard de Fontenelle

quote: To be without some of the things you want is an indispensable part of happiness.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one’s family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one’s own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
author: Buddha

quote: There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human—in not having to be just happy or just sad—in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: Even a happy life cannot be without a measure of darkness, and the word happy would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness. It is far better to take things as they come along with patience and equanimity.
author: Carl Jung

quote: The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.
author: Carrie Jones

quote: Happiness is a way station between too little and too much.
author: Channing Pollock, Mr. Moneypenny

quote: It is not how much we have, but how much we enjoy, that makes happiness.
author: Charles Spurgeon

quote: There is no happiness like that of being loved by your fellow creatures, and feeling that your presence is an addition to their comfort.
author: Charlotte Bronte

quote: If you want happiness for an hour, take a nap. If you want happiness for a day, go fishing. If you want happiness for a year, inherit a fortune. If you want happiness for a lifetime, help someone else.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The only way to find true happiness is to risk being completely cut open.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: Be happy. It’s one way of being wise.
author: Colette

quote: Nobody really cares if you’re miserable, so you might as well be happy.
author: Cynthia Nelms

quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: It isn’t what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: People are unhappy when they get something too easily. You have to sweat – that’s the only moral they know.
author: Dany Laferrière

quote: We can’t control the world. We can only (barely) control our own reactions to it. Happiness is largely a choice, not a right or entitlement.
author: David C. Hill

quote: Happiness cannot be traveled to, owned, earned, worn or consumed. Happiness is the spiritual experience of living every minute with love, grace, and gratitude.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: I think the key to life is just being a happy person, and happiness will bring you success.
author: Diego Val

quote: Happiness is being content with what you have, living in freedom and liberty, having a good family life and good friends.
author: Divyanka Tripathi

quote: Happiness is the interval between periods of unhappiness.
author: Don Marquis

quote: The world is full of people looking for spectacular happiness while they snub contentment.
author: Doug Larson

quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers’ gardens.
author: Douglas Jerrold

quote: Happiness is always the serendipitous result of looking for something else.
author: Dr. Idel Dreimer

quote: Happiness is excitement that has found a settling down place. But there is always a little corner that keeps flapping around.
author: E.L. Konigsburg

quote: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don’t wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future. Think how really precious is the time you have to spend, whether it’s at work or with your family. Every minute should be enjoyed and savored.
author: Earl Nightingale

quote: If only we’d stop trying to be happy we could have a pretty good time.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Happiness is not a goal; it is a by-product.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
author: Epictetus

quote: The search for happiness is one of the chief sources of unhappiness.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: My family didn’t have a lot of money, and I’m grateful for that. Money is the longest route to happiness.
author: Evangeline Lilly

quote: Happiness is a place between too much and too little.
author: Finnish proverb

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: We tend to forget that happiness doesn’t come as a result of getting something we don’t have, but rather of recognizing and appreciating what we do have.
author: Frederick Keonig

quote: There can be no happiness if the things we believe in are different from the things we do.
author: Freya Stark

quote: No medicine cures what happiness cannot.
author: Gabriel García Márquez

quote: Give a man health and a course to steer, and he’ll never stop to trouble about whether he’s happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: There is only one happiness in this life, to love and be loved.
author: George Sand

quote: How simple it is to see that we can only be happy now, and there will never be a time when it is not now.
author: Gerald Jampolsky

quote: Happiness is a by-product of an effort to make someone else happy.
author: Gretta Brooker Palmer

quote: Now and then it’s good to pause in our pursuit of happiness and just be happy.
author: Guillaume Apollinaire

quote: Cheerfulness is what greases the axles of the world. Don’t go through life creaking.
author: H.W. Byles

quote: Happiness and sadness run parallel to each other. When one takes a rest, the other one tends to take up the slack.
author: Hazelmarie Elliott

quote: True happiness is not attained through self-gratification, but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: You can only have bliss if you don’t chase it.
author: Henepola Gunaratana

quote: Happiness is a form of courage.
author: Holbrook Jackson

quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: Real happiness is cheap enough, yet how dearly we pay for its counterfeit.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: So we shall let the reader answer this question for himself: who is the happier man, he who has braved the storm of life and lived or he who has stayed securely on shore and merely existed?
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Happiness is a matter of one’s most ordinary and everyday mode of consciousness being busy and lively and unconcerned with self.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: Happiness is where we find it, but very rarely where we seek it.
author: J. Petit Senn

quote: Happiness is distraction from the human tragedy.
author: J.M. Reinoso

quote: Real happiness is not of temporary enjoyment, but is so interwoven with the future that it blesses for ever.
author: James Lendall Basford

quote: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance, the wise grows it under his feet.
author: James Oppenheim

quote: I must learn to be content with being happier than I deserve.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Who is the happiest of men? He who values the merits of others, and in their pleasure takes joy, even as though it were his own.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Ask yourself whether you are happy and you cease to be so.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Happiness is only real when shared.
author: Jon Krakauer

quote: You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The happiness which is lacking makes one think even the happiness one has unbearable.
author: Joseph Roux

quote: It’s been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will.
author: L.M. Montgomery

quote: There is no cosmetic for beauty like happiness.
author: Lady Blessington

quote: If you look to others for fulfillment, you will never be fulfilled. If your happiness depends on money, you will never be happy with yourself. Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: You can’t be happy unless you’re unhappy sometimes.
author: Lauren Oliver

quote: If you want to be happy, be.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: In order to have great happiness you have to have great pain and unhappiness – otherwise how would you know when you’re happy?
author: Leslie Caron

quote: There are two things to aim at in life: first, to get what you want; and after that, to enjoy it. Only the wisest of mankind achieve the second.
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Happiness is not a state to arrive at, but a manner of traveling.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: Happiness is a constant work-in-progress, because solving problems is a constant work-in-progress – the solutions to today’s problems will lay the foundation for tomorrow’s problems, and so on. True happiness occurs only when you find the problems you enjoy having and enjoy solving.
author: Mark Manson

quote: Sanity and happiness are an impossible combination.
author: Mark Twain

quote: In my life I’ve learned that true happiness comes from giving. Helping others along the way makes you evaluate who you are. I think that love is what we’re all searching for. I haven’t come across anyone who didn’t become a better person through love.
author: Marla Gibbs

quote: Happiness is a well-balanced combination of love, labour, and luck.
author: Mary Wilson Little

quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Ups and downs. Victories and defeats. Sadness and happiness. That’s the best kind of life.
author: Maxime Lagacé

quote: Many things can make you miserable for weeks; few can bring you a whole day of happiness.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Happiness is a conscious choice, not an automatic response.
author: Mildred Barthel

quote: Joy is a net of love by which you can catch souls.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Happiness in this world, when it comes, comes incidentally. Make it the object of pursuit, and it leads us a wild-goose chase, and is never attained.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Happiness is the default state. It’s what’s there when you remove the sense that something is missing in life.
author: Naval Ravikant

quote: Those who can laugh without cause have either found the true meaning of happiness or have gone stark raving mad.
author: Norm Papernick

quote: Happiness is the resultant of the relative strengths of positive and negative feelings rather than an absolute amount of one or the other.
author: Norman Bradburn

quote: Be happy for this moment. This moment is your life.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: Happiness is holding someone in your arms and knowing you hold the whole world.
author: Orhan Pamuk

quote: Happiness is an accident of nature, a beautiful and flawless aberration.
author: Pat Conroy

quote: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: It’s the moments that I stopped just to be, rather than do, that have given me true happiness.
author: Richard Branson

quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Most people would rather be certain they’re miserable, than risk being happy.
author: Robert Anthony

quote: To be happy, you must fancy that everything you have is a gift, and you the chosen, though you worked your tail off for every bit of it.
author: Robert Brault

quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Happiness is the experience of loving life. Being happy is being in love with that momentary experience. And love is looking at someone or even something and seeing the absolute best in him/her or it. Love is happiness with what you see. So love and happiness really are the same thing…just expressed differently.
author: Robert McPhillips

quote: Most of us believe in trying to make other people happy only if they can be happy in ways which we approve.
author: Robert S. Lynd

quote: Happiness is always a by-product. It is probably a matter of temperament, and for anything I know it may be glandular. But it is not something that can be demanded from life, and if you are not happy you had better stop worrying about it and see what treasures you can pluck from your own brand of unhappiness.
author: Robertson Davies

quote: Don’t waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: Pleasure is very seldom found where it is sought. Our brightest blazes are commonly kindled by unexpected sparks.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The happiness of life is made up of the little charities of a kiss or smile, a kind look, a heartfelt compliment.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Judge nothing, you will be happy. Forgive everything, you will be happier. Love everything, you will be happiest.
author: Sri Chinmoy

quote: Sometimes life knocks you on your ass… get up, get up, get up!!! Happiness is not the absence of problems, it’s the ability to deal with them.
author: Steve Maraboli

quote: Happiness is a direction, not a place.
author: Sydney J. Harris

quote: If you are not happy here and now, you never will be.
author: Taisen Deshimaru

quote: There is no way to happiness — happiness is the way.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: Happiness is not being pained in body or troubled in mind.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: We cannot be happy if we expect to live all the time at the highest peak of intensity. Happiness is not a matter of intensity but of balance and order and rhythm and harmony.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: The secret of success is learning how to use pain and pleasure instead of having pain and pleasure use you. If you do that, you’re in control of your life. If you don’t, life controls you.
author: Tony Robbins
