quote: It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom.
author: Unknown

quote: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Unknown

quote: Liars when they speak the truth are not believed.
author: Unknown

quote: Love is composed of single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Unknown

quote: Man is a goal seeking animal. His life only has meaning if he is reaching out and striving for his goals.
author: Unknown

quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
author: Unknown

quote: Men acquire particular quality by constantly acting in a particular way.
author: Unknown

quote: Men are swayed more by fear than by reverence.
author: Unknown

quote: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.
author: Unknown

quote: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
author: Unknown

quote: Most people would rather give than get affection.
author: Unknown

quote: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
author: Unknown

quote: No notice is taken of a little evil, but when it increases it strikes the eye.
author: Unknown

quote: No one would choose a friendless existence on condition of having all the other things in the world.
author: Unknown

quote: Obstinate people can be divided into the opinionated, the ignorant, and the boorish.
author: Unknown

quote: Of all the varieties of virtues, liberalism is the most beloved.
author: Unknown

quote: Perfect friendship is the friendship of men who are good, and alike in excellence; for these wish well alike to each other qua good, and they are good in themselves.
author: Unknown

quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.
author: Unknown

quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Unknown

quote: Poetry demands a man with a special gift for it, or else one with a touch of madness in him.
author: Unknown

quote: Poetry is finer and more philosophical than history; for poetry expresses the universal, and history only the particular.
author: Unknown

quote: Poverty is the parent of revolution and crime.
author: Unknown

quote: Probable impossibilities are to be preferred to improbable possibilities.
author: Unknown

quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Unknown

quote: Republics decline into democracies and democracies degenerate into despotism.
author: Unknown

quote: Something is infinite if, taking it quantity by quantity, we can always take something outside.
author: Unknown

quote: Teenagers these days are out of control. They eat like pigs, they are disrespectful of adults, they interrupt and contradict their parents, and they terrorize their teachers.
author: Unknown

quote: The actuality of thought is life.
author: Unknown

quote: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
author: Unknown

quote: The aim of the wise is not to secure pleasure, but to avoid pain.
author: Unknown

quote: The antidote for fifty enemies is one friend.
author: Unknown

quote: The beauty of the soul shines out when a man bears with composure one heavy mischance after another, not because he does not feel them, but because he is a man of high and heroic temper.
author: Unknown

quote: The difference between a learned man and an ignorant one is the same as that between a living man and a corpse.
author: Unknown

quote: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living from the dead.
author: Unknown

quote: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Unknown

quote: The gods too are fond of a joke.
author: Unknown

quote: The greatest thing by far is to be a master of metaphor; it is the one thing that cannot be learned from others; and it is also a sign of genius, since a good metaphor implies an intuitive perception of the similarity of the dissimilar.
author: Unknown

quote: The happy life is regarded as a life in conformity with virtue. It is a life which involves effort and is not spent in amusement.
author: Unknown

quote: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
author: Unknown

quote: The least initial deviation from the truth is multiplied later a thousand fold.
author: Unknown

quote: The most perfect political community is one in which the middle class is in control, and outnumbers both of the other classes.
author: Unknown

quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
author: Unknown

quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
author: Unknown

quote: The proof that you know something is that you are able to teach it.
author: Unknown

quote: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Unknown

quote: The secret to humor is surprise.
author: Unknown

quote: The society that loses its grip on the past is in danger, for it produces men who know nothing but the present, and who are not aware that life had been, and could be, different from what it is.
author: Unknown

quote: The true and the approximately true are apprehended by the same faculty; it may also be noted that men have a sufficient natural instinct for what is true, and usually do arrive at the truth. Hence the man who makes a good guess at truth is likely to make a good guess at probabilities.
author: Unknown

quote: The ultimate value of life depends upon awareness and the power of contemplation rather than upon mere survival.
author: Unknown

quote: The worst form of inequality is to try to make unequal things equal.
author: Unknown

quote: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
author: Unknown

quote: This is the reason why mothers are more devoted to their children than fathers: it is that they suffer more in giving them birth and are more certain that they are their own.
author: Unknown

quote: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
author: Unknown

quote: Those who educate children well are more to be honored than they who produce them; for these only gave them life, those the art of living well.
author: Unknown

quote: Through discipline comes freedom.
author: Unknown

quote: To be conscious that we are perceiving or thinking is to be conscious of our own existence.
author: Unknown

quote: To love someone is to identify with them.
author: Unknown

quote: To the query, What is a friend? his reply was A single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: Unknown

quote: To write well, express yourself like common people, but think like a wise man. Or, think as wise men do, but speak as the common people do.
author: Unknown

quote: We cannot learn without pain.
author: Unknown

quote: We live in deeds, not years; in thoughts, not breaths; in feelings, not in figures on a dial. We should count time by heart throbs. He most lives who thinks most, feels the noblest, acts the best.
author: Unknown

quote: We make war that we may live in peace.
author: Unknown

quote: We must be neither cowardly nor rash but courageous.
author: Unknown

quote: We praise a man who feels angry on the right grounds and against the right persons and also in the right manner at the right moment and for the right length of time.
author: Unknown

quote: Whosoever is delighted in solitude is either a wild beast or a god.
author: Unknown

quote: Why is it that all those who have become eminent in philosophy, politics, poetry, or the arts are clearly of an atrabilious temperament and some of them to such an extent as to be affected by diseases caused by black bile?
author: Unknown

quote: Wicked men obey from fear; good men, from love.
author: Unknown

quote: Wishing to be friends is quick work, but friendship is a slow-ripening fruit.
author: Unknown

quote: Wit is educated insolence.
author: Unknown

quote: You will never do anything in the world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
author: Unknown

quote: I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Don’t settle for a relationship that won’t let you be yourself.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: I’m selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can’t handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don’t deserve me at my best.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Only time can heal your broken heart, just as only time can heal his broken arms and legs.
author: Miss Piggy

quote: Sexiness is a state of mind – a comfortable state of being. It’s about loving yourself in your most unlovable moments.
author: Halle Berry

quote: We love the things we love for what they are.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Better to have lost and loved than never to have loved at all.
author: Hemingway

quote: It’s better to be unhappy alone than unhappy with someone.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: The greater your capacity to love, the greater your capacity to feel the pain.
author: Jennifer Aniston

quote: The best love is the kind that awakens the soul; that makes us reach for more, that plants the fire in our hearts and brings peace to our minds. That’s what I hope to give you forever.
author: The Notebook

quote: Hearts will never be practical until they are made unbreakable.
author: Wizard of Oz

quote: It was a million tiny little things that, when you added them all up, they meant we were supposed to be together… and I knew it.
author: Tom Hanks, Sleepless In Seattle

quote: Love means never having to say you’re sorry.
author: Ali MacGraw, Love Story

quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quote: To be brave is to love unconditionally without expecting anything in return.
author: Madonna

quote: Your heart is free, have the courage to follow it.
author: Braveheart

quote: I refuse to let what happened to me make me bitter. I still completely believe in love and I’m open to anything that will happen to me.
author: Nicole Kidman

quote: Love to me is someone telling me, ‘I want to be with you for the rest of my life, and if you needed me to I’d jump out of a plane for you.’
author: Jennifer Lopez

quote: Two people in love, alone, isolated from the world, that’s beautiful.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Don’t forget I’m just a girl, standing in front of a boy, asking him to love her.
author: Notting Hill

quote: You don’t marry someone you can live with – you marry the person who you cannot live without.
author: Unknown

quote: Love is just a word, but you bring it definition.
author: Eminem

quote: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart, and the senses.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Pleasure of love lasts but a moment. Pain of love lasts a lifetime.
author: Bette Davis

quote: Men are a luxury. Not a necessity.
author: Cher

quote: Love is a promise; love is a souvenir, once given never forgotten, never let it disappear.
author: John Lennon

quote: Life is messy. Love is messier.
author: Catch and Release

quote: I’m scared of walking out of this room and never feeling the rest of my whole life the way I feel when I’m with you.
author: Dirty Dancing

quote: You know it’s love when all you want is that person to be happy, even if you’re not part of their happiness.
author: Julia Roberts

quote: A book without words is like love without a kiss; it’s empty.
author: Andrew Wolfe

quote: Love is absolute loyalty. People fade, looks fade, but loyalty never fades. You can depend so much on certain people; you can set your watch by them. And that’s love, even if it doesn’t seem very exciting.
author: Sylvester Stallone

quote: The heart wants what it wants. There’s no logic to these things. You meet someone and you fall in love and that’s that.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, and therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: We accept the love we think we deserve.
author: Stephen Chbosky

quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: My heart is, and always will be, yours.
author: Sense and Sensibility

quote: Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Tennyson

quote: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your hearth or burn down your house, you can never tell.
author: Joan Crawford

quote: The best way to mend a broken heart is time and girlfriends.
author: Gwyneth Paltrow

quote: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
author: Friedrich Neitzsche

quote: A simple ‘I love you’ means more than money.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: I like to believe that love is a reciprocal thing, that it can’t really be felt, truly, by one.
author: Sean Penn

quote: When you break up, your whole identity is shattered. It’s like death.
author: Dennis Quaid

quote: Love is blind. It will take over your mind. What you think is love, is truly not. You need to elevate your mind.
author: Eve

quote: And in the end, the love you take, is equal to the love you make.
author: Paul McCartney

quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: Love is needing someone. Love is putting up with someone’s bad qualities because they somehow complete you.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: Love is an emotion experienced by the many and enjoyed by the few.
author: Author Unknown

quote: The only way to prove that you’re a good sport is to lose.
author: Ernie Banks

quote: Only he who can see the invisible can do the impossible.
author: Frank L. Gaines

quote: When you’re riding, only the race in which you’re riding is important.
author: Bill Shoemaker

quote: Age is no barrier. It’s a limitation you put on your mind.
author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

quote: I always felt that my greatest asset was not my physical ability, it was my mental ability.
author: Bruce Jenner

quote: A trophy carries dust. Memories last forever.
author: Mary Lou Retton

quote: Number one is just to gain a passion for running. To love the morning, to love the trail, to love the pace on the track. And if some kid gets really good at it, that’s cool too.
author: Pat Tyson

quote: Most people give up just when they’re about to achieve success. They quit on the one yard line. They give up at the last minute of the game one foot from a winning touchdown.
author: Ross Perot

quote: You have to do something in your life that is honorable and not cowardly if you are to live in peace with yourself.
author: Larry Brown

quote: There may be people that have more talent than you, but theres no excuse for anyone to work harder than you do.
author: Derek Jeter

quote: Baseball is the only field of endeavor where a man can succeed three times out of ten and be considered a good performer.
author: Ted Williams

quote: One man practicing sportsmanship is far better than 50 preaching it.
author: Knute Rockne

quote: The five S’s of sports training are: stamina, speed, strength, skill, and spirit; but the greatest of these is spirit.
author: Ken Doherty

quote: An athlete cannot run with money in his pockets. He must run with hope in his heart and dreams in his head.
author: Emil Zatopek

quote: Somewhere behind the athlete you’ve become and the hours of practice and the coaches who have pushed you is a little girl who fell in love with the game and never looked back… play for her.
author: Mia Hamm

quote: When you’ve got something to prove, there’s nothing greater than a challenge.
author: Terry Bradshaw

quote: Never give up, never give in, and when the upper hand is ours, may we have the ability to handle the win with the dignity that we absorbed the loss.
author: Doug Williams

quote: It’s not the will to win that matters—everyone has that. It’s the will to prepare to win that matters.” – Paul “Bear
author: ” Bryant

quote: Persistence can change failure into extraordinary achievement.
author: Marv Levy

quote: I’ve learned that something constructive comes from every defeat.
author: Tom Landry

quote: Make sure your worst enemy doesn’t live between your own two ears.
author: Laird Hamilton

quote: Set your goals high, and don’t stop till you get there.
author: Bo Jackson

quote: I became a good pitcher when I stopped trying to make them miss the ball and started trying to make them hit it.
author: Sandy Koufax

quote: If you can’t outplay them, outwork them.
author: Ben Hogan

quote: People ask me what I do in winter when there’s no baseball. I’ll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.
author: Rogers Hornsby

quote: Most people never run far enough on their first wind to find out they’ve got a second.
author: William James

quote: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
author: Mike Singletary

quote: If at first you don’t succeed, you are running about average.
author: M.H. Alderson

quote: Continuous effort — not strength or intelligence — is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Liane Cardes

quote: Good is not good when better is expected.
author: Vin Scully

quote: The difference between the impossible and the possible lies in a person’s determination.
author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: Champions keep playing until they get it right.
author: Billie Jean King

quote: You were born to be a player. You were meant to be here. This moment is yours.
author: Herb Brooks

quote: What you lack in talent can be made up with desire, hustle, and giving 110 percent all the time.
author: Don Zimmer

quote: If you fail to prepare, you’re prepared to fail.
author: Mark Spitz

quote: How you respond to the challenge in the second half will determine what you become after the game, whether you are a winner or a loser.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: Persistence can change failure into extraordinary achievement.
author: Matt Biondi

quote: Sports serve society by providing vivid examples of excellence.
author: George F. Will

quote: The principle is competing against yourself. It’s about self-improvement, about being better than you were the day before.
author: Steve Young

quote: The road to Easy Street goes through the sewer.
author: John Madden

quote: You are never really playing an opponent. You are playing yourself, your own highest standards, and when you reach your limits, that is real joy.
author: Arthur Ashe

quote: What makes something special is not just what you have to gain, but what you feel there is to lose.
author: Andre Agassi

quote: The more difficult the victory, the greater the happiness in winning.
author: Pele

quote: One man can be a crucial ingredient on a team, but one man cannot make a team.
author: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar

quote: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.
author: George Halas

quote: Stubbornness usually is considered a negative; but I think that trait has been a positive for me.
author: Cal Ripken Jr.

quote: You’ve got to take the initiative and play your game. In a decisive set, confidence is the difference.
author: Chris Evert

quote: When you win, say nothing, when you lose, say less.
author: Paul Brown

quote: The hardest skill to acquire in this sport is the one where you compete all out, give it all you have, and you are still getting beat no matter what you do. When you have the killer instinct to fight through that, it is very special.
author: Eddie Reese

quote: The mind is the limit. As long as the mind can envision the fact that you can do something, you can do it, as long as you really believe 100 percent.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: When I go out there, I have no pity on my brother. I am out there to win.
author: Joe Frazier

quote: During my 18 years I came to bat almost 10,000 times. I struck out about 1,700 times and walked maybe 1,800 times. You figure a ballplayer will average about 500 at bats a season. That means I played seven years without ever hitting the ball.
author: Mickey Mantle

quote: I never left the field saying I could have done more to get ready and that gives me piece of mind.
author: Peyton Manning

quote: Leadership, like coaching, is fighting for the hearts and souls of men and getting them to believe in you.
author: Eddie Robinson

quote: You win some, you lose some, and some get rained out, but you gotta suit up for them all.
author: J. Askenberg

quote: Always make a total effort, even when the odds are against you.
author: Arnold Palmer

quote: Most talented players don’t always succeed. Some don’t even make the team. It’s more what’s inside.
author: Brett Favre

quote: You have to expect things of yourself before you can do them.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: To uncover your true potential you must first find your own limits and then you have to have the courage to blow past them.
author: Picabo Street

quote: Show me a guy who’s afraid to look bad, and I’ll show you a guy you can beat every time.
author: Lou Brock

quote: You can motivate by fear, and you can motivate by reward. But both those methods are only temporary. The only lasting thing is self motivation.
author: Homer Rice

quote: You find that you have peace of mind and can enjoy yourself, get more sleep, and rest when you know that it was a one hundred percent effort that you gave–win or lose.
author: Gordie Howe

quote: My motto was always to keep swinging. Whether I was in a slump or feeling badly or having trouble off the field, the only thing to do was keep swinging.
author: Hank Aaron

quote: I didn’t believe in team motivation. I believe in getting a team prepared so it knows it will have the necessary confidence when it steps on the field and be prepared to play a good game.
author: Tom Landry

quote: If you train hard, you’ll not only be hard, you’ll be hard to beat.
author: Herschel Walker

quote: Your biggest opponent isn’t the other guy. It’s human nature.
author: Bobby Knight

quote: If you can believe it, the mind can achieve it.
author: Ronnie Lott

quote: Without self-discipline, success is impossible, period.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: If you don’t have confidence, you’ll always find a way not to win.
author: Carl Lewis

quote: Obstacles don’t have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don’t turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Make each day your masterpiece.
author: John Wooden

quote: Excellence is the gradual result of always striving to do better.
author: Pat Riley

quote: Win If You Can, Lose If You Must, But NEVER QUIT!
author: Cameron Trammell

quote: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
author: Mike Singletary

quote: If you have everything under control, you’re not moving fast enough.
author: Mario Andretti

quote: Just keep going. Everybody gets better if they keep at it.
author: Ted Williams

quote: What do do with a mistake: recognize it, admit it, learn from it, forget it.
author: Dean Smith

quote: Push yourself again and again. Don’t give an inch until the final buzzer sounds.
author: Larry Bird

quote: If you aren’t going all the way, why go at all?
author: Joe Namath

quote: You can’t put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
author: Michael Phelps

quote: Do not let what you can not do interfere with what you can do.
author: John Wooden

quote: Pain is temporary. It may last a minute, or an hour, or a day, or a year, but eventually it will subside and something else will take its place. If I quit, however, it lasts forever.
author: Lance Armstrong

quote: Wisdom is always an overmatch for strength.
author: Phil Jackson

quote: The will to win is important, but the will to prepare is vital.
author: Joe Paterno

quote: Adversity cause some men to break; others to break records.
author: William A. Ward

quote: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: Some people say I have attitude – maybe I do…but I think you have to. You have to believe in yourself when no one else does – that makes you a winner right there.
author: Venus Williams

quote: Never let the fear of striking out get in your way.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: It is not the size of a man but the size of his heart that matters.
author: Evander Holyfield

quote:
I hated every minute of training, but I said, ‘Don’t quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.’” – Muhammad Ali
10. “There are only two options regarding commitment. You’re either IN or you’re OUT. There is no such thing as life in-between.” – Pat Riley
9. “A champion is someone who gets up when he can’t.” – Jack Dempsey
8. “It ain’t over till it’s over.” – Yogi Berra
7. “You’re never a loser until you quit trying.” – Mike Ditka
6. “Never give up! Failure and rejection are only the first step to succeeding.” – Jim Valvano
“I’ve missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.” – Michael Jordan (Photo credit: Wikipedia)
5. “You miss 100 percent of the shots you don’t take.” – Wayne Gretzky
4. “The highest compliment that you can pay me is to say that I work hard every day, that I never dog it.” – Wayne Gretzky
3. “Gold medals aren’t really made of gold. They’re made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.” – Dan Gable
2. “I’ve missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.” – Michael Jordan
1. “It’s not whether you get knocked down; it’s whether you get up.
author: ” – Vince Lombardi

quote: You’re never a loser until you quit trying.
author: Mike Ditka

author: Jim Valvano

quote: You miss 100 percent of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

Gold medals aren’t really made of gold. They’re made of sweat, determination, and a hard-to-find alloy called guts.” – Dan Gable
2. “I’ve missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.” – Michael Jordan
1. “It’s not whether you get knocked down; it’s whether you get up.
author: ” – Vince Lombardi

quote: I’ve missed more than 9,000 shots in my career. I’ve lost almost 300 games. 26 times, I’ve been trusted to take the game winning shot and missed. I’ve failed over and over and over again in my life. And that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: It’s not whether you get knocked down; it’s whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Oh, brothers! I don’t care for brothers. My elder brother won’t die, and my younger brothers seem never to do anything else.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Because brothers don’t let each other wander in the dark alone.
author: Jolene Perry

quote: There is a little boy inside the man who is my brother… Oh, how I hated that little boy. And how I love him too.
author: Anna Quindlen

quote: Brothers and sisters are as close as hands and feet.
author: Vietnamese Proverb

quote: Sometimes being a brother is even better than being a superhero.
author: Marc Brown

quote: I, who have no sisters or brothers, look with some degree of innocent envy on those who may be said to be born to friends.
author: James Boswell

quote: I don’t believe an accident of birth makes people sisters or brothers.  It makes them siblings, gives them mutuality of parentage.  Sisterhood and brotherhood is a condition people have to work at.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Mum used to say we were the same soul split in two and walking around on four legs. It seems unnatural being born together and then dying apart.
author: Melodie Ramone

quote: She had always wanted a brother. And she had one now. Sebastian. It was like always wanting a puppy and being a hellhound instead.
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: The younger brother must help to pay for the pleasures of the elder.
author: Jane Austen

quote: When brothers agree, no fortress is so strong as their common life.
author: Antisthenes

quote: After a girl is grown, her little brothers — now her protectors — seem like big brothers.
author: Terri Guillemets

quote: The highlight of my childhood was making my brother laugh so hard that food came out his nose.
author: Garrison Keillor

quote: A brother shares childhood memories and grown-up dreams.
author: Unknown

quote: A friend is a brother who was once a bother.
author: Unknown

quote: It takes two men to make one brother.
author: Israel Zangwill

quote: We have flown the air like birds and swum the sea like fishes, but have yet to learn the simple act of walking the earth like brothers.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Being his real brother I could feel I live in his shadows, but I never have and I do not now. I live in his glow.
author: Michael Morpurgo

quote: Our brothers and sisters are there with us from the dawn of our personal stories to the inevitable dusk.
author: Susan Scarf Merrell

quote: A friend is a brother who was once a bother.
author: Unknown

quote: Help your brother’s boat across, and your own will reach the shore.
author: Hindu Proverb

quote: There is a destiny which makes us brothers; none goes his way alone. All that we send into the lives of others comes back into our own.
author: Edwin Markham

quote: Brothers don’t necessarily have to say anything to each other – they can sit in a room and be together and just be completely comfortable with each other..
author: Leonardo DiCaprio

quote: The best way to get a puppy is to beg for a baby brother – and they’ll settle for a puppy every time.
author: Winston Pendelton

quote: My father used to play with my brother and me in the yard.  Mother would come out and say, “You’re tearing up the grass.”  “We’re not raising grass,” Dad would reply.  “We’re raising boys.
author: ” – Harmon Kellebrew

quote: One can be a brother only in something.  Where there is no tie that binds men, men are not united but merely lined up.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: None of you believes until he wishes for his brother what he wishes for himself.
author: Anonymous

quote: When I look at each of my brothers, I see two things. First, I see the next place I want to leave a rosy welt. Second, I see a good man who will always be there, no matter how hard life gets for me or him. Then, I get out of the way because I realize he’s coming at me with a wet dish towel.
author: Dan Pearce

quote: Nothing can stop me from loving my brother.
author: Brandy Norwood

quote: I grew up with six brothers. That’s how I learned to dance – waiting for the bathroom.
author: Bob Hope

quote: All men were made by the Great Spirit Chief. They are all brothers.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: If you want to know how your girl will treat you after marriage, just listen to her talking to her little brother.
author: Sami Levenson

quote: There’s no other love like the love for a brother. There’s no other love like the love from a brother.
author: Astrid Alauda

quote: To the outside world we all grow old. But not to brothers and sisters. We know each other as we always were. We know each other’s hearts. We share private family jokes. We remember family feuds and secrets, family griefs and joys. We live outside the touch of time.
author: Clara Ortega

quote: My sister was drowning in the ocean once, and my brother and I dove in and saved her. True story. She owes us her life. It’s great leverage; we abuse it all the time!
author: Matt Barr

quote: I grew up with a younger brother, so I can get pretty rowdy.
author: Sarah Wynter

quote: It snowed last year too: I made a snowman and my brother knocked it down and I knocked my brother down and then we had tea.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Blessed is the servant who loves his brother as much when he is sick and useless as when he is well and an be of service to him. And blessed is he who loves his brother as well when he is afar off as when he is by his side, and who would say nothing behind his back he might not, in love, say before his face.
author: St. Francis of Assisi

quote: A sibling may be the keeper of one’s identity, the only person with the keys to one’s unfettered, more fundamental self.
author: Marian Sandmaier

quote: Being pretty on the inside means you don’t hit your brother and you eat all your peas – that’s what my grandma taught me..
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: I sought my soul, but my soul I could not see. I sought my God, but my God eluded me. I sought my brother and I found all three.
author: Unknown

quote: Never make a companion equal to a brother.
author: Hesiod

quote: It was nice growing up with someone like you – someone to lean on, someone to count on… someone to tell on!
author: Unknown

quote: I was a tomboy and I didn’t have a bunch of brothers but I always wanted them and so I sort of adopted a few of my great friends to be my brother..
author: Olivia Wilde

quote: I hated Chris, my brother. I would pull his hair and kick him, until one day my father gave him permission to fight back. I’ll be apologizing to him for the rest of my life.
author: Stevie Nicks

quote: My big brother still thinks he’s a better singer than me.
author: Rod Stewart

quote: I can’t work with my brother without laughing.
author: Dick van Dyke

quote: My father wants me to be like my brother, but I can’t be.
author: Robert Mapplethorpe

quote: If you have a brother or sister, tell them you love them every day – that’s the most beautiful thing. I told my sister how much I loved her every day. That’s the only reason I’m OK right now.
author: Amaury Nolasco

quote: Children of the same family, the same blood, with the same first associations and habits, have some means of enjoyment in their power, which no subsequent connections can supply.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Life is composed of lights and shadows, and we would be untruthful, insincere, and saccharine if we tried to pretend there were no shadows.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Laughter is America’s most important export.
author: Unknown

quote: There is more treasure in books than in all the pirate’s loot on Treasure Island.
author: Unknown

quote: The era we are living in today is a dream of coming true.
author: Unknown

quote: Somehow I can’t believe that there are any heights that can’t be scaled by a man who knows the secrets of making dreams come true. This special secret, it seems to me, can be summarized in four C s. They are curiosity, confidence, courage, and constancy.
author: Unknown

quote: There is great comfort and inspiration in the feeling of close human relationships and its bearing on our mutual fortunes – a powerful force, to overcome the “tough breaks” which are certain to come to most of us from time to time.
author: ” -Walt Disney

quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.
author: Unknown

quote: The worst of us is not without innocence, although buried deeply it might be.
author: Unknown

quote: Leadership means that a group, large or small, is willing to entrust authority to a person who has shown judgment, wisdom, personal appeal, and proven competence.
author: Unknown

quote: Fantasy and reality often overlap.
author: Unknown

quote: Laughter is timeless, imagination has no age, dreams are forever.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The important thing is the family. If you can keep the family together — and that’s the backbone of our whole business, catering to families — that’s what we hope to do.
author: Unknown

quote: There’s nothing funnier than the human animal.
author: Unknown

quote: Our heritage and ideals, our code and standards – the things we live by and teach our children – are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.
author: Unknown

quote: You reach a point where you don’t work for money.
author: Unknown

quote: For every laugh, there should be a tear.
author: Walt Disney

quote: You can’t just let nature run wild.
author: Unknown

quote: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Unknown

quote: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
author: Unknown

quote: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Do a good job. You don’t have to worry about the money; it will take care of itself. Just do your best work — then try to trump it.
author: Unknown

quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
author: Unknown

quote: A person should set his goals as early as he can and devote all his energy and talent to getting there. With enough effort, he may achieve it. Or he may find something that is even more rewarding. But in the end, no matter what the outcome, he will know he has been alive.
author: Unknown

quote: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
author: Walt Disney

quote: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Unknown

quote: All the adversity I’ve had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me… You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
author: Unknown

quote: Why worry? If you’ve done the very best you can, worrying won’t make it any better.
author: Unknown

quote: First, think. Second, believe. Third, dream. And finally, dare.
author: Unknown

quote: Get a good idea and stay with it. Dog it, and work at it until it’s done right.
author: Unknown

quote: The difference between winning and losing is most often not quitting.
author: Unknown

quote: Whatever you do, do it well.
author: Walt Disney

quote: All you’ve got to do is own up to your ignorance honestly, and you’ll find people who are eager to fill your head with information.
author: Unknown

quote: Everyone falls down. Getting back up is how you learn how to walk.
author: Unknown

quote: Never get bored or cynical. Yesterday is a thing of the past.
author: Unknown

quote: Courage is the main quality of leadership, in my opinion, no matter where it is exercised. Usually it implies some risk — especially in new undertakings. Courage to initiate something and to keep it going, pioneering and adventurous spirit to blaze new ways, often, in our land of opportunity.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s kind of fun to do the impossible.
author: Walt Disney

quote: People often ask me if I know the secret of success and if I could tell others how to make their dreams come true. My answer is, you do it by working.
author: Unknown

quote: When you’re curious, you find lots of interesting things to do. And one thing it takes to accomplish something is courage.
author: Unknown

quote: That’s the real trouble with the world, too many people grow up. They forget.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Crowded classrooms and half-day sessions are a tragic waste of our greatest national resource – the minds of our children.
author: Unknown

quote: Adults are interested if you don’t play down to the little 2 or 3 year olds or talk down. I don’t believe in talking down to children. I don’t believe in talking down to any certain segment. I like to kind of just talk in a general way to the audience. Children are always reaching.
author: Unknown

quote: Children are people, and they should have to reach to learn about things, to understand things, just as adults have to reach if they want to grow in mental stature.
author: Unknown

quote: Childishness? I think it’s the equivalent of never losing your sense of humor. I mean, there’s a certain something that you retain. It’s the equivalent of not getting so stuffy that you can’t laugh at others.
author: Unknown

quote: Our greatest natural resource is the minds of our children.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I do not make films primarily for children. I make them for the child in all of us, whether he be six or sixty. Call the child innocence.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t believe in playing down to children, either in life or in motion pictures. I didn’t treat my own youngsters like fragile flowers, and I think no parent should.
author: Unknown

quote: I have long felt that the way to keep children out of trouble is to keep them interested in things.
author: Unknown

quote: Why do we have to grow up? I know more adults who have the children’s approach to life. They’re people who don’t give a hang what the Jones’ do. You see them at Disneyland every time you go there. They are not afraid to be delighted with simple pleasures, and they have a degree of contentment with what life has brought – sometimes it isn’t much, either.
author: Unknown

quote: You’re dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.
author: Unknown

quote: Every child is born blessed with a vivid imagination. But just as a muscle grows flabby with disuse, so the bright imagination of a child pales in later years if he ceases to exercise it.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s a mistake not to give people a chance to learn to depend on themselves while they are young.
author: Unknown

quote: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
author: Unknown

quote: Animation is different from other parts. Its language is the language of caricature. Our most difficult job was to develop the cartoon’s unnatural but seemingly natural anatomy for humans and animals.
author: Unknown

quote: All cartoon characters and fables must be exaggeration, caricatures. It is the very nature of fantasy and fable.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Animation can explain whatever the mind of man can conceive. This facility makes it the most versatile and explicit means of communication yet devised for quick mass appreciation.
author: Unknown

quote: In our animation we must show only the actions and reactions of a character, but we must picture also with the action. . . the feeling of those characters.
author: Unknown

quote: I try to build a full personality for each of our cartoon characters – to make them personalities.
author: Unknown

quote: I think a good study of music would be indispensable to the animators — a realization on their part of how primitive music is, how natural it is for people to want to go to music — a study of rhythm, the dance — the various rhythms enter into our lives every day.
author: Unknown

quote: Until a character becomes a personality it cannot be believed. Without personality, the character may do funny or interesting things, but unless people are able to identify themselves with the character, its actions will seem unreal. And without personality, a story cannot ring true to the audience.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I think you have to know these fellows definitely before you can draw them. When you start to caricature a person,you can’t do it without knowing the person. Take Laurel and Hardy for example; everybody can see Laurel doing certain things because they know Laurel.
author: Unknown

quote: Of all of our inventions for mass communication, pictures still speak the most universally understood language.
author: Unknown

quote: I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known.
author: Unknown

quote: Mickey Mouse is, to me, a symbol of independence. He was a means to an end.
author: Walt Disney

quote: When people laugh at Mickey Mouse, it’s because he’s so human; and that is the secret of his popularity.
author: Unknown

quote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.
author: Unknown

quote: I only hope that we don’t lose sight of one thing – that it was all started by a mouse.
author: Unknown

quote: Disneyland will never be completed. It will continue to grow as long as there is imagination left in the world.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t want the public to see the world they live in while they’re in the Park (Disneyland). I want to feel they’re in another world.
author: Unknown

quote: Disneyland is a work of love. We didn’t go into Disneyland just with the idea of making money.
author: Unknown

quote: Disneyland is the star, everything else is in the supporting role.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We did it Disneyland, in the knowledge that most of the people I talked to thought it would be a financial disaster – closed and forgotten within the first year.
author: Unknown

quote: Disneyland is a show.
author: Unknown

quote: I could never convince the financiers that Disneyland was feasible, because dreams offer too little collateral.
author: Unknown

quote: You can dream, create, design and build the most wonderful place in the world, but it requires people to make the dream a reality.
author: Unknown

quote: We keep moving forward, opening new doors, and doing new things, because we’re curious and curiosity keeps leading us down new paths.
author: Walt Disney

quote: We are not trying to entertain the critics. I’ll take my chances with the public.
author: Unknown

quote: We allow no geniuses around our Studio.
author: Unknown

quote: Movies can and do have tremendous influence in shaping young lives in the realm of entertainment towards the ideals and objectives of normal adulthood.
author: Unknown

quote: We have created characters and animated them in the dimension of depth, revealing through them to our perturbed world that the things we have in common far outnumber and outweigh those that divide us.
author: Unknown

quote: At first the cartoon medium was just a novelty, but it never really began to hit until we had more than tricks… until we developed personalities. We had to get beyond getting a laugh. They may roll in the aisles, but that doesn’t mean you have a great picture. You have pathos in the thing.
author: Unknown

quote: Times and conditions change so rapidly that we must keep our aim constantly focused on the future.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I take great pride in the artistic development of cartoons. Our characters are made to go through emotions.
author: Unknown

quote: I wanted to retain my individuality. I was afraid of being hampered by studio policies. I knew if someone else got control, I would be restrained.
author: Unknown

quote: My greatest reward is that I have been able to build this wonderful organization.
author: Unknown

quote: I would rather entertain and hope that people learned something than educate people and hope they were entertained.
author: Unknown

quote: I believe in being an innovator.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I never called my work an ‘art’. It’s part of show business, the business of building entertainment.
author: Unknown

quote: I believe in being a motivator.
author: Unknown

quote: I am interested in entertaining people, in bringing pleasure, particularly laughter, to others, rather than being concerned with ‘expressing’ myself with obscure creative impressions.
author: Unknown

quote: I am not influenced by the techniques or fashions of any other motion picture company.
author: Unknown

quote: I am corny, you know? But I think there are just about 140 million people in this country who are just as corny as I am.
author: Unknown

quote: I resent the limitations of my own imagination.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I am in no sense of the word a great artist, not even a great animator; I have always had men working for me whose skills were greater than my own. I am an idea man.
author: Unknown

quote: When I was a kid, a book I read advised young artists to be themselves. That decided it for me. I was a corny kind of guy, so I went in for corn.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t make pictures just to make money. I make money to make more pictures.
author: Unknown

quote: I have never been interested in personal gain or profit. This business and this studio have been my entire life.
author: Unknown

quote: In bad times and in good, I’ve never lost my sense of zest for life.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Money doesn’t excite me, my ideas excite me.
author: Unknown

quote: Most of my life I have done what I wanted to do. I have had fun on the job.
author: Unknown

quote: I dream, I test my dreams against my beliefs, I dare to take risks, and I execute my vision to make those dreams come true.
author: Unknown

quote: Of all the things I’ve done, the most vital is coordinating those who work with me and aiming their efforts at a certain goal.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t like formal gardens. I like wild nature. It’s just the wilderness instinct in me, I guess.
author: Unknown

quote: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
author: Unknown

quote: I have been up against tough competition all my life. I wouldn’t know how to get along without it.
author: Walt Disney

quote: I’d say it’s been my biggest problem all my life… it’s money. It takes a lot of money to make these dreams come true.
author: Unknown

quote: I have no use for people who throw their weight around as celebrities, or for those who fawn over you just because you are famous.
author: Unknown

quote: Whenever I go on a ride, I’m always thinking of what’s wrong with the thing and how it can be improved.
author: Unknown

quote: When we do the best we can, we never know what miracle is wrought in our life, or in the life of another.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Any woman who understands the problems of running a home will be nearer to understanding the problems of running a country.
author: Margaret Thatcher

quote: If you obey all the rules, you miss all the fun.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Being an intellectual creates a lot of questions and no answers. You can fill your life up with ideas and still go home lonely. All you really have that really matters are feelings. That’s what music is to me.
author: Janis Joplin

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one’s courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: If you don’t like being a doormat then get off the floor.
author: Al Anon

quote: Whatever you do, be different – that was the advice my mother gave me, and I can’t think of better advice for an entrepreneur. If you’re different, you will stand out.
author: Anita Roddick

quote: A lot of people are afraid to say what they want. That’s why they don’t get what they want.
author: Madonna

quote: A woman is like a tea bag – you never know how strong she is until she gets in hot water.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: I know God will not give me anything I can’t handle. I just wish that He didn’t trust me so much.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Destiny is a name often given in retrospect to choices that had dramatic consequences.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: I could not, at any age, be content to take my place by the fireside and simply look on. Life was meant to be lived. Curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The day will come when men will recognize woman as his peer, not only at the fireside, but in councils of the nation. Then, and not until then, will there be the perfect comradeship, the ideal union between the sexes that shall result in the highest development of the race.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: We ask justice, we ask equality, we ask that all the civil and political rights that belong to citizens of the United States, be guaranteed to us and our daughters forever.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: I’ve come to believe that each of us has a personal calling that’s as unique as a fingerprint – and that the best way to succeed is to discover what you love and then find a way to offer it to others in the form of service, working hard, and also allowing the energy of the universe to lead you.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: It was we, the people; not we, the white male citizens; nor yet we, the male citizens; but we, the whole people, who formed the Union…. Men, their rights and nothing more; women, their rights and nothing less.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: A strong woman understands that the gifts such as logic, decisiveness, and strength are just as feminine as intuition and emotional connection. She values and uses all of her gifts.
author: Nancy Rathburn

quote: A woman is the full circle. Within her is the power to create, nurture and transform.
author: Diane Mariechild

quote: I want to do is because I want to do it. Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail, their failure must be but a challenge to others.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Just watch, all of you men. I’ll show you what a woman can do…I’ll go across the country, I’ll race to the Moon… I’ll never look back.
author: Edna Gardner Whyte

quote: The best protection any woman can have … is courage.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: We must believe that we are gifted for something, and that this thing, at whatever cost, must be attained.
author: Marie Curie

quote: Success breeds confidence.
author: Beryl Markham

quote: Because I am a woman, I must make unusual efforts to succeed. If I fail, no one will say, “She doesn’t have what it takes.” They will say, “Women don’t have what it takes.
author: ” – Clare Boothe Luce

quote: The way in which we think of ourselves has everything to do with how our world see us and how we see ourselves successfully acknowledged by the world.
author: Arlene Rankin

quote: Love is anterior to Life, Posterior to Death, Initial of Creation, and The Exponent of Earth.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: The question isn’t who’s going to let me; it’s who is going to stop me.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Most people who meet my wife quickly conclude that she is remarkable. They are right about this. She is smart, funny and thoroughly charming. Often, after hearing her speak at some function or working with her on a project, people will approach me and say something to the effect of, you know, I think the world of you, Barack, but your wife, wow!
author: Barack Obama, The Audacity of Hope

quote: People think at the end of the day that a man is the only answer [to fulfillment]. Actually a job is better for me.
author: Princess Diana

quote: If you look at what you have in life, you’ll always have more. If you look at what you don’t have in life, you’ll never have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Whatever women do they must do twice as well as men to be thought half as good. Luckily, this is not difficult.
author: Charlotte Whitton

quote: The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.
author: Alice Walker

quote: One likes people much better when they’re battered down by a prodigious siege of misfortune than when they triumph.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. In fact, it may be necessary to encounter the defeats, so you can know who you are, what you can rise from, how you can still come out of it.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Women are never stronger than when they arm themselves with their weaknesses.
author: Madame Marie du Deffand

quote: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
author: Helen Keller

quote: When you lose a couple of times, it makes you realize how difficult it is to win.
author: Steffi Graf

quote: You take your life in your own hands, and what happens? A terrible thing, no one to blame.
author: Erica Jong

quote: You move totally away from reality when you believe that there is a legitimate reason to suffer.
author: Byron Katie

quote: Courage is like a muscle. We strengthen it by use.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: Always go with the choice that scares you the most, because that’s the one that is going to require the most from you.
author: Caroline Myss

quote: Stop wearing your wishbone where your backbone ought to be.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: One of the most courageous things you can do is identify yourself, know who you are, what you believe in and where you want to go.
author: Sheila Murray Bethel

quote: It takes a great deal of courage to stand up to your enemies, but even more to stand up to your friends.
author: J. K. Rowling

quote: Taking joy in living is a woman’s best cosmetic.
author: Rosalind Russell

quote: Woman must not accept; she must challenge.She must not be awed by that which has been built up around her; she must reverence that woman in her which struggles for expression.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: You can have unbelievable intelligence, you can have connections, you can have opportunities fall out of the sky. But in the end, hard work is the true, enduring characteristic of successful people.
author: Marsha Evans

quote: A woman with a voice is by definition a strong woman. But the search to find that voice can be remarkably difficult.
author: Melinda Gates

quote: A man’s got to do what a man’s got to do. A woman must do what he can’t.
author: Rhonda Hansome

quote: We still live in a world in which a significant fraction of people, including women, believe that a woman belongs and wants to belong exclusively in the home.
author: Rosalyn Sussman

quote: You have to have confidence in your ability, and then be tough enough to follow through.
author: Rosalynn Carter

quote: One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Be thankful for what you have; you’ll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don’t have, you will never, ever have enough.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Pride slays thanksgiving, but a humble mind is the soil out of which thanks naturally grow. A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Thanksgiving dinners take eighteen hours to prepare. They are consumed in twelve minutes. Half-times take twelve minutes. This is not coincidence.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: Our rural ancestors, with little blest, Patient of labour when the end was rest, Indulged the day that housed their annual grain, With feasts, and off’rings, and a thankful strain.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: He who thanks but with the lips Thanks but in part; The full, the true Thanksgiving Comes from the heart.
author: J.A. Shedd

quote: Drink and be thankful to the host! What seems insignificant when you have it, is important when you need it.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Let us remember that, as much has been given us, much will be expected from us, and that true homage comes from the heart as well as from the lips, and shows itself in deeds.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: If you think about a Thanksgiving dinner, it’s really like making a large chicken.
author: Ina Garten

quote: But see, in our open clearings, how golden the melons lie; Enrich them with sweets and spices, and give us the pumpkin-pie!
author: Margaret Junkin Preston

quote: Thanksgiving is an emotional holiday. People travel thousands of miles to be with people they only see once a year. And then discover once a year is way too often.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Gratitude unlocks the fullness of life. It turns what we have into enough, and more. It turns denial into acceptance, chaos to order, confusion to clarity. It can turn a meal into a feast, a house into a home, a stranger into a friend. Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today and creates a vision for tomorrow.
author: Melody Beattie

quote: Remember God’s bounty in the year. String the pearls of His favor. Hide the dark parts, except so far as they are breaking out in light! Give this one day to thanks, to joy, to gratitude!
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: On Thanksgiving Day we acknowledge our dependence.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: I come from a family where gravy is considered a beverage.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: The Pilgrims made seven times more graves than huts. No Americans have been more impoverished than these who, nevertheless, set aside a day of thanksgiving.
author: H.U. Westermayer

quote: Thanksgiving Day is a jewel, to set in the hearts of honest men; but be careful that you do not take the day, and leave out the gratitude.
author: E.P. Powell

quote: Thanksgiving was never meant to be shut up in a single day.
author: Robert Caspar Lintner

quote: It has been an unchallengeable American doctrine that cranberry sauce, a pink goo with overtones of sugared tomatoes, is a delectable necessity of the Thanksgiving board and that turkey is uneatable without it.
author: Alistair Cooke

quote: Thanksgiving comes to us out of the prehistoric dimness, universal to all ages and all faiths. At whatever straws we must grasp, there is always a time for gratitude and new beginnings.
author: J. Robert Moskin

quote: There is one day that is ours. There is one day when all we Americans who are not self-made go back to the old home to eat saleratus biscuits and marvel how much nearer to the porch the old pump looks than it used to. Thanksgiving Day is the one day that is purely American.
author: O. Henry, Two Thanksgiving Day Gentlemen

quote: Give thanks not just on Thanksgiving Day, but every day of your life. Appreciate and never take for granted all that you have.
author: Catherine Pulsifer

quote: I celebrated Thanksgiving in an old-fashioned way. I invited everyone in my neighborhood to my house, we had an enormous feast, and then I killed them and took their land.
author: Jon Stewart

quote: Not what we say about our blessings, but how we use them, is the true measure of our thanksgiving.
author: W.T. Purkiser

quote: Thanksgiving is the holiday of peace, the celebration of work and the simple life… a true folk-festival that speaks the poetry of the turn of the seasons, the beauty of seedtime and harvest, the ripe product of the year — and the deep, deep connection of all these things with God.
author: Ray Stannard Baker

quote: What I love about Thanksgiving is that it’s purely about getting together with friends or family and enjoying food. It’s really for everybody, and it doesn’t matter where you’re from.
author: Daniel Humm

quote: Thanksgiving is one of my favorite days of the year because it reminds us to give thanks and to count our blessings. Suddenly, so many things become so little when we realize how blessed and lucky we are.
author: Joyce Giraud

quote: Almighty God, who hast given us this good land for our heritage; We humbly beseech Thee that we may always prove ourselves a people mindful of Thy favor and glad to do Thy will.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: All across America, we gather this week with the people we love to give thanks to God for the blessings in our lives.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings, of which every man has plenty; not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Gratitude is the inward feeling of kindness received. Thankfulness is the natural impulse to express that feeling. Thanksgiving is the following of that impulse.
author: Henry Van Dyke

quote: When asked if my cup is half-full or half-empty my only response is that I am thankful I have a cup.
author: Sam Lefkowitz

quote: Thanksgiving, man. Not a good day to be my pants.
author: Kevin James

quote: I like football. I find its an exciting strategic game. Its a great way to avoid conversation with your family at Thanksgiving.
author: Craig Ferguson

quote: The more we express thanks, the more gratitude we feel. The more gratitude we feel, the more we express thanks. It’s circular, and it leads to a happier life.
author: Steve Goodier

quote: The roots of all goodness lie in the soil of appreciation for goodness.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Thanksgiving reminds us that no matter what befalls us in life, we can take the charred remnants and we can reconstruct a life unimaginably richer than that from which the shards and pieces fell.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough

quote: Although Thanksgiving comes but once a year, every day should be a day of Thanks. Among all the challenges that we face as people with hearing loss there are certainly brighter moments in every day – moments that deserve to be recorded in our Gratitude Journal.
author: Monique Hammond

quote: Real ballplayers pass the stuffing by rolling it up in a ball and batting it across the table with a turkey leg.
author: Tom Swyers

quote: Thanksgiving is a time of togetherness and gratitude.
author: Nigel Hamilton

quote: Thanksgiving Day is a good day to recommit our energies to giving thanks and just giving.
author: Amy Grant

quote: Thanksgiving just gets me all warm and tingly and all kinds of wonderful inside.
author: Willard Scott

quote: My most memorable meal is every Thanksgiving. I love the food: the turkey and stuffing; the sweet potatoes and rice, which come from my mother’s Southern heritage; the mashed potatoes, which come from my wife’s Midwestern roots; the Campbell’s green-bean casserole; and of course, pumpkin pie.
author: Douglas Conant

quote: On Thanksgiving I will stop to give thanks that my family is safe and healthy, especially because I realize that, following the tragedies of this year, it is all too real a possibility that they might not have been.
author: Bobby Jindal

quote: You shouldn’t just give during Christmas and Thanksgiving you should be giving all the time.
author: Alcurtis Turner

quote: My fondest memories are generally the day after Thanksgiving. I get the total decorating Christmas itch.
author: Katharine McPhee

quote: Thanksgiving is one of my favorite days of the year because it reminds us to give thanks and to count our blessings. Suddenly, so many things become so little when we realize how blessed and lucky we are.
author: Joyce Giraud

quote: It’s like being at the kids’ table at Thanksgiving – you can put your elbows on it, you don’t have to talk politics… no matter how old I get, there’s always a part of me that’s sitting there.
author: John Hughes

quote: An optimist is a person who starts a new diet on Thanksgiving Day.
author: Irv Kupcinet

quote: Thanksgiving, our eminent moral holiday, doesn’t have much for children. At its heart are conversation, food, drink, and fellowship – all perks of adulthood.
author: Rosecrans Baldwin

quote: Thanksgiving is America’s favorite holiday because it’s a time when we put aside our cares, much as the struggling Pilgrims did nearly four centuries ago, and eat a gut-busting meal without worrying about the ‘out years.'
author: David Ignatius

quote: What we’re really talking about is a wonderful day set aside on the fourth Thursday of November when no one diets. I mean, why else would they call it Thanksgiving?
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: But see, in our open clearings, how golden the melons lie; Enrich them with sweets and spices, and give us the pumpkin-pie!
author: Margaret Junkin Preston

quote: Coexistence: what the farmer does with the turkey — until Thanksgiving.
author: Mike Connolly

quote: Stand up, on this Thanksgiving Day, stand upon your feet. Believe in man. Soberly and with clear eyes, believe in your own time and place. There is not, and there never has been a better time, or a better place to live in.
author: Phillips Brooks

quote: A thankful heart is not only the greatest virtue, but the parent of all the other virtues.
author: Cicero

quote: And though I ebb in worth, I’ll flow in thanks.
author: John Taylor

quote: I suppose I will die never knowing what pumpkin pie tastes like when you have room for it.
author: Robert Brault

quote: Thanksgiving is so called because we are all so thankful that it only comes once a year.
author: P. J. O’Rourke

quote: Thanksgiving is America’s national chow-down feast, the one occasion each year when gluttony becomes a patriotic duty.
author: Michael Dresser

quote: Not what we say about our blessings, but how we use them, is the true measure of our thanksgiving.
author: W.T. Purkiser

quote: If you want to turn your life around, try thankfulness. It will change your life mightily.
author: Gerald Good

quote: If you are really thankful, what do you do? You share.
author: W. Clement Stone

quote: I love Thanksgiving because it’s a holiday that is centered around food and family, two things that are of utmost importance to me.
author: Marcus Samuelsson

quote: The thankful receiver bears a plentiful harvest.
author: William Blake

quote: Cooking Tip: Wrap turkey leftovers in aluminum foil and throw them out.
author: Nicole Hollander

quote: It took me three weeks to stuff the turkey. I stuffed it through the beak.
author: Phyllis Diller

quote: Thanksgiving Day comes, by statute, once a year; to the honest man it comes as frequently as the heart of gratitude will allow.
author: Edward Sandford Martin

quote: The Thanksgiving tradition is, we overeat. ‘Hey, how about at Thanksgiving we just eat a lot?’ ‘But we do that every day!’ ‘Oh. What if we eat a lot with people that annoy the hell out of us?
author: Jim Gaffigan

quote: I’m from Canada, so Thanksgiving to me is just Thursday with more food. And I’m thankful for that.
author: Howie Mandel

quote: If you stand in the meat section at the grocery store long enough, you start to get mad at turkeys. There’s turkey ham, turkey bologna, turkey pastrami. Someone needs to tell the turkey, man, just be yourself.
author: Mitch Hedberg

quote: Thanksgiving, after all, is a word of action.
author: W.J. Cameron

quote: Vegetables are a must on a diet. I suggest carrot cake, zucchini bread, and pumpkin pie.
author: Jim Davis/span>

quote: Most turkeys taste better the day after; my mother’s tasted better the day before.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: You can tell you ate too much for Thanksgiving when you have to let your bathrobe out.
author: Jay Leno

quote: Forever on Thanksgiving Day The heart will find the pathway home.
author: Wilbur D. Nesbit

quote: My Thanksgiving is perpetual. It is surprising how contented one can be with nothing definite — only a sense of existence.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Thanksgiving is a joyous invitation to shower the world with love and gratitude.
author: Amy Leigh Mercree

quote: Thanksgiving Quotes from Books, Films, and Television
author: Unknown

quote: A thought about Thanksgiving Day: Once, there was this day… this one day when… everyone realized they needed each other.
author: April Burns in Pieces of April

quote: Here I am, 5 o’clock in the morning, stuffing bread crumbs up a dead bird’s butt.
author: Rosanne in Rosanne

quote: We can only be said to be alive in those moments when our hearts are conscious of our treasures.
author: Thornton Wilder, The Woman of Andros

quote: Thanksgiving creates abundance.
author: Ann Voskamp, One Thousand Gifts

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one’s own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde, A Woman of No Importance

quote: Thanksgiving was nothing more than a pilgrim-created obstacle in the way of Christmas; a dead bird in the street that forced a brief detour.
author: Augusten Burroughs, You Better Not Cry: Stories for Christmas

quote: The funny thing about Thanksgiving ,or any big meal, is that you spend 12 hours shopping for it then go home and cook,chop,braise and blanch. Then it’s gone in 20 minutes and everybody lies around sortof in a sugar coma and then it takes 4 hours to clean it up.
author: Ted Allen, The Food You Want to Eat: 100 Smart, Simple Recipes

quote: I always think it’s funny when Indians celebrate Thanksgiving. I mean, sure, the Indians and Pilgrims were best friends during the first Thanksgiving, but a few years later, the Pilgrims were shooting Indians. So I’m never quite sure why we eat Turkey like everybody else.
author: Sherman Alexie, The Absolutely True Diary of a Part-Time Indian

quote: America has developed a pie tradition unequivocally and unapologetically at the sweet end of the scale, and at no time is this better demonstrated than at Thanksgiving.
author: Janet Clarkson, Pie: A Global History

quote: Preparing and serving food had always been a joy, for it made her appreciate the abundance of the world.
author: Elizabeth Camden, Until The Dawn

quote: About 94 percent of Americans prepare and serve turkey at home and most people stick to a traditional menu for the main meal: turkey with cranberry sauce, mashed white potatoes with giblet gravy, candied sweet potatoes topped with marshmallows, a cooked green vegetable dish, relishes, and a pumpkin pie with whipped cream for dessert.
author: Martin K. Gay, Encyclopedia of North American Eating & Drinking Traditions, Customs, and Rituals

quote: Family gathers to share good noise and good food. Gratitude abounds.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Making Wishes: Quotes, Thoughts, & a Little Poetry for Every Day of the Year

quote: ’So what do we do?’ We do what all families do. Grin, bear it, and pass the mashed potatoes.
author: ” – Heather Brewer, Eleventh Grade Burns

quote: The next day, eating a turkey sandwich with salt and mayonnaise, Rebecca decided Thanksgiving was the best holiday, although she had little to choose from: her family never celebrated Hanukkah but her father was militant about ignoring Christmas and insisted they spend December 25 eating Chinese takeout and going to the movies.
author: Anna Quindlen, Still Life with Bread Crumbs

quote: Now if you’ll excuse me, I’m going to go baste the turkey and hide the kitchen knives.
author: Mrs. Pascal in The House of Yes

quote: In November, people are good to each other. They carry pies to each other’s homes and talk by crackling woodstoves, sipping mellow cider. They travel very far on a special November day just to share a meal with one another and to give thanks for their many blessings – for the food on their tables and the babies in their arms.
author: Cynthia Rylant, In November

quote: Thanksgiving – fall’s finale. Best damn holiday of the year in my worldly estimation.
author: Carew Papritz, The Legacy Letters: his Wife, his Children, his Final Gift

quote: Thanksgiving is the holiday that encompasses all others. All of them, from Martin Luther King Day to Arbor Day to Christmas to Valentine’s Day, are in one way or another about being thankful.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer, Eating Animals

quote: Overeating at Thanksgiving is a case in point. It’s a national tradition.
author: Eric Samuel Timm, Static Jedi: The Art of Hearing God Through the Noise

quote: It’s not too much food. This is what we’ve been training for our whole lives. This is our destiny, this is our finest hour.
author: Lorelai Gilmore in Gilmore Girls

quote: I can’t cook a Thanksgiving dinner. All I can make is cold cereal and maybe toast.
author: Charlie Brown in A Charlie Brown Thanksgiving

quote: Turkey: A large bird whose flesh, when eaten on certain religious anniversaries has the peculiar property of attesting piety and gratitude.
author: Ambrose Bierce, The Devil’s Dictionary

quote: Once you start practicing being grateful and thankful for things, people, and events, you may notice that you start to attract more positive things, people, and events in your life.
author: Stephanie Conkle, Happy Person. Happy Life. A recipe for happiness

quote: We all can ‘act’ a certain way for a brief period of time, for instance, on Thanksgiving, who of us hasn’t had to ‘act’ like we just loved everyone at the table? This brief show of good behavior is not true character. Our character is who we are when no one is looking.
author: Becky Van Volkinburg, God’s Word, Your Voice

quote: Now is no time to think of what you do not have. Think of what you can do with what there is.
author: Ernest Hemingway, The Old Man and the Sea

quote: Small cheer and great welcome makes a merry feast.
author: William Shakespeare, Balthasar in The Comedy of Errors

quote: Turkey for the girls and Turkey for the boys. My favorite kind of pants are corduroys. Gobble gobble goo and Gobble gobble gickel. I wish turkey only cost a nickel. Oh I love turkey on Thanksgiving. Happy Thanksgiving everybody!
author: Adam Sandler, The Thanksgiving Song

quote: I decided, very early on, just to accept life unconditionally; I never expected it to do anything special for me, yet I seemed to accomplish far more than I had ever hoped. Most of the time it just happened to me without my ever seeking it.
author: Unknown

quote: I decided, very early on, just to accept life unconditionally; I never expected it to do anything special for me, yet I seemed to accomplish far more than I had ever hoped. Most of the time it just happened to me without my ever seeking it.
author: Unknown

quote: Living is like tearing through a museum. Not until later do you really start absorbing what you saw, thinking about it, looking it up in a book, and remembering – because you can’t take it in all at once.
author: Unknown

quote: There is one difference between a long life and a great dinner; in the dinner, the sweet things come last.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: My own life has been much more than a fairy tale. I’ve had my share of difficult moments, but whatever difficulties I’ve gone through, I’ve always gotten the prize at the end.
author: Unknown

quote: The greatest victory has been to be able to live with myself, to accept my shortcomings… I’m a long way from the human being I’d like to be. But I’ve decided I’m not so bad after all.
author: Unknown

quote: I have learnt how to live…how to be in the world and of the world, and not just to stand aside and watch.
author: Unknown

quote: Pick the day. Enjoy it – to the hilt. The day as it comes. People as they come… The past, I think, has helped me appreciate the present – and I don’t want to spoil any of it by fretting about the future.
author: Unknown

quote: Not to live for the day, that would be materialistic — but to treasure the day. I realize that most of us live on the skin — on the surface — without appreciating just how wonderful it is simply to be alive at all.
author: Unknown

quote: I believe, every day, you should have at least one exquisite moment.
author: Unknown

quote: Life is a party. Dress for it.
author: Unknown

quote: Giving is living. If you stop wanting to give, there’s nothing more to live for.
author: Unknown

quote: People, even more than things, have to be restored, renewed, revived, reclaimed, and redeemed; never throw out anyone.
author: Unknown

quote: You can tell more about a person by what he says about others than you can by what others say about him.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it.
author: Unknown

quote: Your heart just breaks, that’s all. But you can’t judge, or point fingers. You just have to be lucky enough to find someone who appreciates you.
author: Unknown

quote: If I get married, I want to be very married.
author: Unknown

quote: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
author: Audrey Hepburn
