quote: When you have nobody you can make a cup of tea for, when nobody needs you, that’s when I think life is over.
author: Unknown

quote: We all want to be loved, don’t we? Everyone looks for a way of finding love. It’s a constant search for affection in every walk of life.
author: Unknown

quote: When the chips are down, you are alone, and loneliness can be terrifying. Fortunately, I’ve always had a chum I could call. And I love to be alone. It doesn’t bother me one bit. I’m my own company.
author: Unknown

quote: I may not always be offered work, but I’ll always have my family.
author: Unknown

quote: True friends are families which you can select.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Whatever a man might do, whatever misery or heartache your children might give you – and they give you a lot – however much your parents irritate you – it doesn’t matter because you love them.
author: Unknown

quote: They say love is the best investment; the more you give, the more you get in return.
author: Unknown

quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says ‘I’m possible’!
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Pick the day. Enjoy it – to the hilt. The day as it comes. People as they come… The past, I think, has helped me appreciate the present – and I don’t want to spoil any of it by fretting about the future.
author: Unknown

quote: I tried always to do better: saw always a little further. I tried to stretch myself.
author: Unknown

quote: To plant a garden is to believe in tomorrow.
author: Unknown

quote: I heard a definition once: Happiness is health and a short memory! I wish I’d invented it, because it is very true.
author: Unknown

quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it’s all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles.
author: Unknown

quote: I believe in manicures. I believe in overdressing. I believe in primping at leisure and wearing lipstick. I believe in pink. I believe happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day, and… I believe in miracles.
author: Unknown

quote: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you’re exactly the same.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: I probably hold the distinction of being one movie star who, by all laws of logic, should never have made it. At each stage of my career, I lacked the experience.
author: Unknown

quote: I never think of myself as an icon. What is in other people’s mind is not in my mind. I just do my thing.
author: Unknown

quote: There are certain shades of limelight that can wreck a girl’s complexion.
author: Unknown

quote: My greatest ambition is to have a career without becoming a career woman.
author: Unknown

quote: :I’ve been lucky. Opportunities don’t often come along. So, when they do, you have to grab them.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: When you have found it, you should stick to it.
author: Unknown

quote: It is too much to hope that I shall keep up my success. I don’t ask for that. All I shall do is my best – and hope.
author: Unknown

quote:
You can watch Audrey Hepburn win her very first oscar here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p-vR7D21wqI
author: Unknown

quote: Good things aren’t supposed to just fall into your lap. God is very generous, but He expects you to do your part first.
author: Unknown

quote: As you grow older you will discover that you have two hands. One for helping yourself, the other for helping others.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: I love people who make me laugh. I honestly think it’s the thing I like most, to laugh. It cures a multitude of ills. It’s probably the most important thing in a person.
author: Unknown

quote: Why change? Everyone has his own style. When you have found it, you should stick to it.
author: Unknown

quote: For me the only things of interests are those linked to the heart.
author: Unknown

quote: Anyone who does not believe in miracles is not a realist.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: On the one hand maybe I’ve remained infantile, while on the other I matured quickly, because at a young age I was very aware of suffering and fear.
author: Unknown

quote: It’s that wonderful old-fashioned idea that others come first and you come second. This was the whole ethic by which I was brought up. Others matter more than you do, so don’t fuss, dear; get on with it.
author: Unknown

quote: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: The beauty in a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart; the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It’s the caring and that she lovingly gives the passion that she shows and the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years.
author: Unknown

quote: Elegance is the only beauty that never fades. A woman can be beautiful as well as intellectual. It’s that wonderful old-fashioned idea that others come first and you come second. This was the whole ethic by which I was brought up. Others matter more than you do, so ‘don’t fuss, dear; get on with it.’
author: Unknown

quote: Sex appeal is something that you feel deep down inside. It’s suggested rather than shown. I’m not as well-stacked as Sophia Loren or Gina Lollobrigida, but there is more to sex appeal than just measurements. I don’t need a bedroom to prove my womanliness. I can convey just as much sex appeal, picking apples off a tree or standing in the rain.
author: Unknown

quote: The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides.
author: Unknown

quote: Look, whenever I hear or read I’m beautiful, I simply don’t understand it … I’m certainly not beautiful in any conventional way. I didn’t make my career on beauty.
author: Unknown

quote: The beauty of a woman is not in a facial mole, but true beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It is the caring that she lovingly gives, the passion that she knows.
author: Unknown

quote: A woman can be beautiful as well as intellectual.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Make-up can only make you look pretty on the outside but it doesn’t help if your ugly on the inside. Unless you eat the make-up.
author: Unknown

quote: And the beauty of a woman, with passing years only grows!
author: Unknown

quote: My look is attainable. Women can look like Audrey Hepburn by flipping out their hair, buying the large sunglasses, and the little sleeveless dresses.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m not beautiful. My mother once called me an ugly duckling. But, listed separately, I have a few good features.
author: Unknown

quote: There are more important things than outward appearance. No amount of makeup can cover an ugly personality.
author: Unknown

quote: Dress like you are already famous.
author: Unknown

quote: I saw but one glaring truth: These are not natural disasters but man-made tragedies for which there is only one man-made solution-peace.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t believe in collective guilt, but I do believe in collective responsibility.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: The ‘Third World’ is a term I don’t like very much, because we’re all one world. I want people to know that the largest part of humanity is suffering.
author: Unknown

quote: I can testify to what UNICEF means to children, because I was among those who received food and medical relief right after World War II. I have a long-lasting gratitude and trust for what UNICEF does.
author: Unknown

quote: It makes me self-conscious. It’s because I’m known, in the limelight, that it’s getting all the gravy, but if you knew, if you saw some of the people who make it possible for UNICEF to help these children survive. These are the people who do the jobs-the unknowns, whose names you will never know…I at least get a dollar a year, but they don’t.
author: Unknown

quote: Taking care of children has nothing to do with politics. I think perhaps with time, instead of there being a politicization of humanitarian aid, there will be a humanization of politics.
author: Unknown

quote: People in these places don’t know Audrey Hepburn, but they recognize the name UNICEF. When they see UNICEF their faces light up, because they know that something is happening. In the Sudan, for example, they call a water pump UNICEF.
author: Unknown

quote: A quality education has the power to transform societies in a single generation, provide children with the protection they need from the hazards of poverty, labor exploitation and disease, and given them the knowledge, skills, and confidence to reach their full potential.
author: Unknown

quote: Water is life, and clean water means health.
author: Unknown

quote: Since the world has existed, there has been injustice. But it is one world, the more so as it becomes smaller, more accessible. There is just no question that there is more obligation that those who have should give to those who have nothing.
author: Unknown

quote: My first big mission for UNICEF in Ethiopia was just to attract attention, before it was too late, to conditions which threatened the whole country. My role was to inform the world, to make sure that the people of Ethiopia were not forgotten.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t want to be alone, I want to be left alone.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Some people dream of having a big swimming pool. With me, it’s closets.
author: Unknown

quote: If I’m honest, I have to tell you I still read fairy tales and I like them best of all.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m an introvert… I love being by myself, love being outdoors, love taking a long walk with my dogs and looking at the trees, flowers, the sky.
author: Unknown

quote: You can always tell what kind of a person a man really thinks you are by the earrings he gives you.
author: Unknown

quote: Paris is always a good idea.
author: Unknown

quote: Everything I learned I learned from the movies.
author: Unknown

quote: I have to be alone very often. I’d be quite happy if I spent from Saturday night until Monday morning alone in my apartment. That’s how I refuel.
author: Unknown

quote: As a matter of fact, I rather feel like expressing myself now.
author: Unknown

quote: For my whole life, my favorite activity was reading. It’s not the most social pastime.
author: Unknown

quote: I never think of myself as an icon. What is in other people’s minds is not in my mind. I just do my thing.
author: Unknown

quote: There must be something wrong with those people who think Audrey Hepburn doesn’t perspire, hiccup or sneeze, because they know that’s not true. In fact, I hiccup more than most.
author: Unknown

quote: In Holland and Belgium, and afterwards in England, my happiest moments were in the country. I’ve always had a passion for the outdoors, for trees, for birds and flowers.
author: Unknown

quote: If my world were to cave in tomorrow, I would look back on all the pleasures, excitements and worthwhilenesses I have been lucky enough to have had. Not the sadness, not my miscarriages or my father leaving home, but the joy of everything else. It will have been enough.
author: Unknown

quote: Let’s face it, a nice creamy chocolate cake does a lot for a lot of people; it does for me.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: I never thought I’d land in pictures with a face like mine.
author: Unknown

quote: I was asked to act when I couldn’t act. I was asked to sing ‘Funny Face’ when I couldn’t sing, and dance with Fred Astaire when I couldn’t dance – and do all kinds of things I wasn’t prepared for. Then I tried like mad to cope with it.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m not a born actress, as such, I care about expressing feelings.
author: Unknown

quote: People associate me with a time when movies were pleasant, when women wore pretty dresses in films and you heard beautiful music. I always love it when people write me and and say ‘I was having a rotten time, and I walked into a cinema and saw one of your movies, and it made such a difference.’
author: Unknown

quote: [I have] enormous faith, but it’s not attached to any one in particular religion. My mother was one thing, my father another. In Holland they were all Calvinists. That has no importance at all to me.
author: Unknown

quote: I was born with something that appealed to an audience at that particular time…I acted instinctively. I’ve had one of the greatest schools of all – a whole row of great, great directors.
author: Unknown

quote: I’m half-Irish, half-Dutch, and I was born in Belgium. If I was a dog, I’d be in a hell of a mess!
author: Unknown

quote: Actually, you have to be a little bit in love with your leading man and vice versa. If you’re going to portray love, you have to feel it. You can’t do it any other way. But you don’t carry it beyond the set.
author: Unknown

quote: I had to make a choice at one point in my life, of missing films or missing my children. It was a very easy decision to make because I missed my children so very much.
author: Unknown

quote: She did the best that we could be; she was perfectly charming and perfectly loving. She was a dream. And she was the kind of dream that you remember when you wake up smiling. In a cruel and imperfect world, she was living proof that God could still create perfection.
author: Richard Dreyfuss

quote: In a cruel and imperfect world, she was living proof that God could still create perfection.
author: Rex Reed

quote: Audrey was the kind of person who when she saw someone else suffering tried to take their pain on herself. She was a healer. She knew how to love. You didn’t have to be in constant contact with her to feel you had a friend. We always picked up right where we left off.
author: Shirley Maclaine

quote: Audrey had an angelic quality about her. She didn’t act like she was better than everyone, she just had a presence, an energy, a sort of light coming from within her that was overwhelming.
author: Kevyn Aucoin

quote: The extraordinary mystique of hers made you think she lived on rose petals and listened to nothing but Mozart, but it wasn’t true. She was quite funny and ribald. She could tell a dirty joke. She played charades with a great sense of fun and vulgarity, and she could be quite bitchy.
author: André Previn

quote: Audrey gave more than she ever got. The whole world is going to miss her.
author: Steven Spielberg

quote: The imprint of Miss Hepburn is absolutely, totally present. Like it or not, she will be the most important look of the twentieth century.
author: Manolo Blahnik

quote: She truly became our ‘fair lady.’ The children of the world have lost a true friend, and an important and eloquent advocate.
author: James P. Grant

quote: Also, can we take a moment to appreciate the fact that there has never been and probably will never be another actress as thoroughly lovable as Audrey Hepburn.
author: Rachel Heffington

quote: Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: All that was great in the past was ridiculed, condemned, combated, suppressed – only to emerge all the more powerfully, all the more triumphantly from the struggle.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: If it’s a good idea, go ahead and do it. It’s easier to ask forgiveness than it is to get permission.
author: Grace Murray Hooper

quote: The most dangerous notion a young man can acquire is that there is no more room for originality. There is no large room for anything else.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The biggest risk is not taking any risk. In a world that’s changing really quickly, the only strategy that is guaranteed to fail is not taking risks.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

quote: The truth is the only thing you’ll ever run into that has no agenda.
author: Adyashanti

quote: Wherever you are, be there totally. If you find your here and now intolerable and it makes you unhappy, you have three options: remove yourself from the situation, change it, or accept it totally. If you want to take responsibility for your life, you must choose one of those three options, and you must choose now. Then accept the consequences.
author: Eckhart Tolle

quote: Fear keeps us focused on the past or worried about the future. If we can acknowledge our fear, we can realize that right now we are okay. Right now, today, we are still alive, and our bodies are working marvellously. Our eyes can still see the beautiful sky. Our ears can still hear the voices of our loved ones.
author: Thich Nhat Hahn

quote: When we meet real tragedy in life, we can react in two ways – either by losing hope and falling into self-destructive habits, or by using the challenge to find our inner strength. Thanks to the teachings of Buddha, I have been able to take this second way.
author: Dalai Lama

quote: Mere philosophy will not satisfy us. We cannot reach the goal by mere words alone. Without practice, nothing can be achieved.
author: Swami Satchidananda

quote: Education in the key to unlock the golden door of freedom.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: Revolutionary’ discipline depends on political consciousness – on an understanding of why orders must be obeyed; it takes time to diffuse this, but it also takes time to drill a man into an automaton on the barrack-square.
author: George Orwell

quote: We’ve got to face the fact that some people say you fight fire best with fire, but we say you put fire out best with water. We say you don’t fight racism with racism. We’re gonna fight racism with solidarity.
author: Fred Hampton

quote: Everyone who knows anything of history also knows that great social revolutions are impossible without the feminine ferment. Social progress may be measured precisely by the social position of the fair sex (plain ones included).
author: Karl Marx

quote: You must not lose faith in humanity. Humanity is an ocean; if a few drops of the ocean are dirty, the ocean does not become dirty.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: What did you do as a child that made the hours pass like minutes? Herein lies the key to your earthly pursuits.
author: Carl Jung

quote: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: It is just that we should be grateful, not only to those with whose views we may agree, but also to those who have expressed more superficial views; for these also contributed something, by developing before us the powers of thought.
author: Aristotle

quote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: The notion that a human being should be constantly happy is a uniquely modern, uniquely American, uniquely destructive idea.
author: Andrew Weil

quote: Monsters are real, ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes they win.
author: Stephen King

quote: It takes a thousand men to invent a telegraph, or a steam engine, or a phonograph, or a photograph, or a telephone or any other important thing—and the last man gets the credit and we forget the others. He added his little mite — that is all he did. These object lessons should teach us that ninety-nine parts of all things that proceed from the intellect are plagiarisms, pure and simple; and the lesson ought to make us modest. But nothing can do that.
author: Mark Twain

quote: I want to taste and glory in each day, and never be afraid to experience pain.
author: Sylvia Plath

quote: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all – in which case, you fail by default.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: And in the end, we were all just humans… drunk on the idea that love, only love, could heal our brokenness.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald.

quote: Never ruin an apology with an excuse.
author: Unknown

quote: An apology is a lovely perfume; it can transform the clumsiest moment into a gracious gift.
author: Margaret Lee Runbeck

quote: In this life, when you deny someone an apology, you will remember it at time you beg forgiveness..
author: Toba Beta

quote: An apology is a good way to have the last word.
author: Unknown

quote: Never make a defense or an apology until you are accused.
author: King Charles I

quote: The only good thing about punctuality is that it usually gets you an apology.
author: Unknown

quote: Would ‘sorry’ have made any difference? Does it ever? It’s just a word. One word against a thousand actions.
author: Sarah Ockler

quote: I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing.
author: Plato

quote:
Never forget the nine most important words of any family-
I love you.
You are beautiful.
Please forgive me.
author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quote: Never apologize for showing your feelings. When you do, you are apologizing for the truth.
author: Jose N. Harris

quote: An apology is the super glue of life. It can repair just about anything.
author: Lynn Johnston

quote: My life is an apology for the life of my father.
author: Kristin Cashore

quote: I’m sorry.’ The two most inadequate words in the English language.
author: Beth Revis

quote: An apology given just to appease one’s conscience is self-serving and better left unspoken!
author: Evinda Lepins

quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
author: J.R.R.Tolkien

quote: Sacrifice is at the heart of repentance. Without deeds, your apology is worthless.
author: Bryan Davis

quote: An apology can be a wonderful thing so long as it is infrequent and from the heart. However, beware of the person who justifies bad behavior with apologies. For them it is a means to an end, and quite often at your expense.
author: Gary Hopkins

quote: An apology for the devil: it must be remembered that we have heard one side of the case. God has written all the books.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: More people should apologize, and more people should accept apologies when sincerely made.
author: Greg LeMond

quote: Right actions in the future are the best apologies for bad actions in the past.
author: Tyron Edwards

quote: An apology might help, but you can change your life without one.
author: Robin Quivers

quote: Friends are God’s apology for relations..
author: Hugh Kingsmill

quote: A hero is someone we can admire without apology.
author: Kitty Kelley

quote: It will never do to plead sin as an excuse for sin, or to attempt to justify sinful acts by pleading that we have an evil heart. This instead of being a valid apology, is the very ground of our condemnation.
author: Archibald Alexander

quote: Nothing wrong with apologizing, but saying I’m sorry does nothing when you continue to make the same mistakes..
author: Unknown

quote: Forgiveness is the sweetest revenge.
author: Isaac Friedmann

quote: Some people accidentally walk on your feet and apologize, while others walk all over your heart and don’t even realize.
author: Unknown

quote: In some families, please is described as the magic word. In our house, however, it was sorry..
author: Margaret Laurence

quote: Saying sorry to someone is hard… but putting your pride down for someone is the hardest.
author: Cristina Orante

quote: A person can apologize endlessly, and even if you forgive them, sometimes you can’t forget the pain they’ve caused you.
author: Nishan Panwar

quote: Never apologize for having high standards. People who really want to be in your life will rise up to meet them..
author: Suman Rai

quote: Any good apology has 3 parts: 1)I’m sorry 2)It’s my fault 3)What can I do to make it right? Most people forget the third part.
author: Unknown

quote: You can always say sorry, But the real apology is when you hear the sadness in their voice and see the look in their eyes. And you realize that they have hurt themselves just as much..
author: Kid Cudi

quote: I understand the concept of being the bigger person but I do not understand why some people apologize to others when they weren’t wrong.
author: Unknown

quote: Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
author: Paul Boese

quote: True friends stab you in the front.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: True remorse is never just a regret over consequence; it is a regret over motive.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: A stiff apology is a second insult…. The injured party does not want to be compensated because he has been wronged; he wants to be healed because he has been hurt.
author: G. K. Chesterton

quote: I’m sorry you’re angry” is NOT an apology.
author: ” – Lisa Lutz

quote: Pride and ego makes a mockery of an apology. Humility wins forgiveness without question…so break ‘yo’self’!
author: T. F. Hodge

quote: Accept everything about yourself – I mean everything, You are you and that is the beginning and the end – no apologies, no regrets.
author: Henry Kissinger

quote: Apologies only account for that which they do not alter.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The ability of a person to atone has always been the most remarkable of human features.
author: Leon Uris

quote: Remember, we all stumble, every one of us.  That’s why it’s a comfort to go hand in hand.
author: Emily Kimbrough

quote: For every minute you are angry, you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
author: Unknown

quote: The more rational statement is that we feel sorry because we strike, afraid because we tremble, and not that we cry, strike, or tremble because we are sorry, angry, or fearful as the case may be.
author: William James

quote: You can make up a quarrel, but it will always show where it was patched.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quote: Maturity is the ability to reap without apology and not complain when things don’t go well.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: The only correct actions are those that demand no explanation and no apology.
author: Red Auerbach

quote: The most important trip you may take in life is meeting people halfway.
author: Henry Boye

quote: We can complain because rose bushes have thorns, or rejoice because thorns have roses.
author: Alphonse Karr

quote: You can, you should, and if you’re brave enough to start, you will.
author: Stephen King

quote: What is the difference between an obstacle and an opportunity? Our attitude toward it. Every opportunity has a difficult, and every difficulty has an opportunity.
author: J. Sidlow Baxter

quote: Believing in negative thoughts is the single greatest obstruction to success.
author: Charles F. Glassman

quote: Don’t be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quote: The only place where your dreams become impossible is in your own thinking,
author: Robert H Shuller

quote: Fall seven times and stand up eight.
author: Anonymous

quote: We become what we think about.
author: Early Nightingale

quote: Cultivate an optimistic mind, use your imagination, always consider alternatives, and dare to believe that you can make possible what others think is impossible.
author: Rodolfo Costa

quote: Beliefs that are good promote your potential and enhance your unique special qualities.
author: Deborah Day

quote: When you are joyful, when you say yes to life and have fun and project positivity all around you, you become a sun in the center of every constellation, and people want to be near you.
author: Shannon L. Alder

quote: It’s a funny thing about life, once you begin to take note of the things you are grateful for, you begin to lose sight of the things that you lack.
author: Germany Kent

quote: Life is a gift, and it offers us the privilege, opportunity and responsibility to give something back by becoming more.
author: Tony Robbins

quote: The greatest discovery of all time is that a person can change his future by merely changing his attitude.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: Happiness is a quality of the soul…not a function of one’s material circumstances.
author: Aristotle

quote: Impossible is just an opinion, don’t buy it.
author: Robin Sharma

quote: An attitude of positive expectation is the mark of the superior personality.
author: Brian Tracy

quote: Optimism is the most important human trait, because it allows us to evolve our ideas, to improve our situation, and to hope for a better tomorrow.
author: Seth Godin

quote: People inspire you or they drain you – pick them wisely.
author: Hans Hasen

quote: I think it’s important to get your surroundings as well as yourself into a positive state – meaning surround yourself with positive people, not the kind who are negative and jealous of everything you do.
author: Heidi Klum

quote: Surround yourself with the dreamers, and the doers, the believers, and thinkers, but most of all, surround yourself with those who see the greatness within you, even when you don’t see it yourself.
author: Edmund Lee

quote: Bad company corrupts good character.
author: Anonymous

quote: Surround yourself with those who only lift you higher.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: It’s most important that you surround yourself with positivity always, and have it in your mind at all times.
author: Tyler Perry

quote: Don’t hang with negative people. They will pull you down with them. Instead, invite them into your light and together you will both shine strong.
author: L.F. Young

quote: An attitude of positive expectation is the mark of the superior personality
author: Brian Tracy

quote: The most important thing you will ever wear is your attitude.
author: Jeff Moore

quote: Be the attitude you want to be around.
author: Tim DeTellis

quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: Being sexy is all about attitude, not body type. It’s a state of mind.
author: Amisha Patel

quote: Positive thinking is more than just a tagline. It changes the way we behave. And I firmly believe that when I am positive, it not only makes me better, but it also makes those around me better.
author: Harvey Mackay

quote: A powerful attitude awakens inner strength, energy, motivation, and initiative.
author: Remez Sasson

quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
author: J.R.R.Tolkien

quote: I belong to the people I love, and they belong to me- they, and the love and loyaty I give them, form my identity far more than any word or group ever could.
author: Veronica Roth

quote: Loyalty to the country always. Loyalty to the government when it deserves it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.
author: Ann Landers

quote: Hold faithfulness and sincerity as first principles.
author: Confucius

quote: Faithless is he that says farewell when the road darkens.
author: J.R.R.Tolkien

quote: A man is not an orange. You can’t eat the fruit and throw the peel away.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: The strength of a family, like the strength of an army, is in its loyalty to each other.
author: Mario Puzo

quote: I look for these qualities and characteristics in people. Honesty is number one, respect, and absolutely the third would have to be loyalty.
author: Summer Altice

quote: Better to have one woman on your side than ten men.
author: Robert Jordan

quote: I’ll take fifty percent efficiency to get one hundred percent loyalty.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: If you will not die for us, you cannot ask us to die for you.
author: Jacqueline Carey

quote: If put to the pinch, an ounce of loyalty is worth a pound of cleverness.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: All men are loyal, but their objects of allegiance are at best approximate.
author: John Barth

quote: I don’t like to give up on people when they need someone not to give up on them.
author: Carrol Bryant

quote: Where the battle rages, there the loyalty of the soldier is proved.
author: Martin Luther

quote: It isn’t an easy thing to give your loyalty to someone you don’t know, especially when that person chooses to reveal nothing of himself.
author: Megan Whaler Turner

quote: A person who deserves my loyalty receives it..
author: Joyce Maynard

quote: I have a loyalty that runs in my bloodstream, when I lock into someone or something, you can’t get me away from it because I commit that thoroughly. That’s in friendship, that’s a deal, that’s a commitment. Don’t give me paper – I can get the same lawyer who drew it up to break it. But if you shake my hand, that’s for life..
author: Jerry Lewis

quote: As you read my stories of long ago I hope you will remember that the things that are truly worthwhile and that will give you happiness are the same now as they were then. Courage and kindness, loyalty, truth, and helpfulness are always the same and always needed.
author: Laura Ingles Wilder

quote: My dear boy, the people who only love once in their lives are really the shallow people. What they call their loyalty, and their fidelity, I call either the lethargy of custom or their lack of imagination. Faithfulness is to the emotional life what consistency is to the life of the intellect—simply a confession of failures.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Unlike the puerile loyalty to a conviction, loyalty to a friend is a virtue – perhaps the only virtue, the last remaining one.
author: Milan Kundera

quote: Loyalty to an unjust cause is a perversion of honor.
author: Brian Herbert & Kevin J. Anderson

quote: Loyalty is dead, the experts proclaim, and the statistics seem to bear them out. On average, U.S. corporations now lose half their customers in five years, half their employees in four, and half their investors in less than one. We seem to face a future in which the only business relationships will be opportunistic transactions between virtual strangers.
author: Frederick R. Reichheld

quote: A person is born with feelings of envy and hate. If he gives way to them, they will lead him to violence and crime, and any sense of loyalty and good faith will be abandoned.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I’ve ever thought I’d have.
author: Ernie Banks

quote: A friend is someone who walks into a room when everyone else is walking out.
author: Gary Moore

quote: Together we shared a bond not even death would violate.
author: Dee Remy

quote: Loyalty cannot be blueprinted. It cannot be produced on an assembly line. In fact, it cannot be manufactured at all, for its origin is the human heart — the center of self-respect and human dignity. It is a force which leaps into being only when conditions are exactly right for it — and it is a force very sensitive to betrayal.
author: Maurice Franks

quote: Sometimes it was worth all the disadvantages of marriage just to have that: one friend in an indifferent world.
author: Erica Jong

quote: I think a good friend, to me, is all about trust and loyalty. You don’t ever want to second-guess whether you can tell your friend something.
author: Lauren Conrad

quote: I place an enormous premium on loyalty. If someone betrays me, I can forgive them rationally, but emotionally I have found it impossible to do so.
author: Richard E. Grant

quote: You don’t earn loyalty in a day. You earn loyalty day-by-day.
author: Jeffrey Gitomer

quote: Fidelity purchased with money, money can destroy.
author: Seneca

quote: My first language, the true language of the soul spoken only on our planet of origin, had no word for betrayal or traitor. Or even loyalty- because without the opposite, the concept had no meaning.
author: Stephanie Meyer

quote: A true friendship is one in which everything can be told, and nothing will be judged.
author: Unknown

quote: If you cant value a commitment made by someone else, your own commitments lose their value too.
author: Ram Mohan

quote: …it isn’t things and proximity, or even blood that holds us all together. What makes a family is love and loyalty.
author: Genevieve Dewey

quote: You can easily judge the character of a man by how he treats those who can do nothing for him.
author: Goethe

quote: The first step in the evolution of ethics is a sense of solidarity with other human beings.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Friendship with oneself is all-important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Never befriend the oppressed unless you are prepared to take on the oppressor.
author: Ogden Nash

quote: New friends are silver, but old friends are gold.
author: Unknown

quote: Loyalty publicly results in leverage privately.
author: Andy Stanley

quote: Friends may come and go, but enemies accumulate.
author: Thomas Hudson Jones

quote: Loyal companions are an unequaled grace, stanching fear before it bleeds you numb, a reliable antidote for creeping despair.
author: Dean Koontz

quote: An onion shared with a friend tastes like roast lamb.
author: Egyptian Proverb

quote: The final test of a leader is that he leaves behind him in other men the conviction and will to carry on.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Never esteem anything as of advantage to you that will make you break your word or lose your self-respect.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The highest compact we can make with our fellow is – “Let there be truth between us two for evermore.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: It only ends once. Anything that happens before that is just progress.
author: Jacob on Lost

quote: Don’t cry because it’s over, smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Choose to be optimistic, it feels better.
author: Dalai Lama XIV

quote:
We’ll never survive!”
“Nonsense. You’re only saying that because no one ever has.
author: ”  – William Goldman

quote: The basis of optimism is sheer terror.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: It isn’t all over; everything has not been invented; the human adventure is just beginning.
author: Gene Roddenberry

quote: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
author: Anne Frank

quote: There is some good in this world, and it’s worth fighting for.
author: J.R.R.Tolkien

quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: For myself I am an optimist – it does not seem to be much use to be anything else.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: As long as there was coffee in the world, how bad could things be?
author: Cassandra Clare

quote: Beyond each impenetrable expanse of thundercloud obscurity reigns a boundless canopy of brilliant sapphire blue.
author: Cara Fox

quote: I can’t change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
author: Jimmy Dean

quote: Those who wish to sing, always find a song.
author: Swedish Proverb

quote: I think I am going to have to supercharge my optimism to arm myself for the battle ahead. Trust me, it is going to be a battle.
author: Rebecca Bloom

quote: Life is too short to spend your precious time trying to convince a person who wants to live in gloom and doom otherwise. Give lifting that person your best shot, but don’t hang around long enough for his or her bad attitude to pull you down. Instead, surround yourself with optimistic people.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: When you are asked if you can do a job, tell ’em, ‘Certainly I can!’ Then get busy and find out how to do it.
author: ” – Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Every problem has a gift for you in its hands.
author: Richard Bach

quote: The average pencil is seven inches long, with just a half-inch eraser – in case you thought optimism was dead.
author: Robert Brault

quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
author: Helen Keller

quote: I am so far from being a pessimist…on the contrary, in spite of my scars, I am tickled to death at life.
author: Eugene O’Neill

quote: ’m a pessimist because of intelligence, but an optimist because of will.
author: Antonio Gramsci

quote: The man who is a pessimist before 48 knows too much; if he is an optimist after it he knows too little.
author: Mark Twain

quote: One of the things I learned the hard way was that it doesn’t pay to get discouraged. Keeping busy and making optimism a way of life can restore your faith in yourself.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Optimism is the madness of insisting that all is well when we are miserable.
author: Voltaire

quote: These are the soul’s changes. I don’t believe in ageing. I believe in forever altering one’s aspect to the sun. Hence my optimism.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: I am enjoying my life because things aren’t going the way I planned.
author: Rohit Pandita

quote: Keep a light, hopeful heart. But ¬expect the worst.
author: Joyce Carol Oates

quote: Pessimism never won any battle.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

quote: Everything great was accomplished by fools who dreamed.
author: Emily Dana

quote: Negativity is often looked upon [in the USA] as a kind of thought crime. Not since the advent of socialist realism has the world witnessed such pathological upbeatness.
author: Terry Eagleton

quote: No man ever threw away life while it was worth keeping.
author: David Hume

quote: I am an optimist. Anyone interested in the future has to be otherwise he would simply shoot himself.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: If this is the best of possible worlds, what then are the others?
author: Voltaire

quote: Be fanatically positive and militantly optimistic. If something is not to your liking, change your liking.
author: Rick Steves

quote: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.
author: Lucy Larcom

quote: They can because they think they can.
author: Virgil

quote: Don’t let your failures define you—let them teach you.
author: Barack Obama

quote: Faith is taking the first step, even when you don’ts ee the whole staircase.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Relax. They’re not going to kill us. They’re going to TRY and kill us. And that is a very different thing..
author: Steve Voake

quote: Always something new, always something I didn’t expect, and sometimes it isn’t horrible.
author: Robert Jordan

quote: If I can’t joke about imminent death, then I might as well just resign.
author: James A. Owen

quote: When you have vision it affects your attitude. Your attitude is optimistic rather than pessimistic.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

quote: To the question whether I am a pessimist or an optimist, I answer that my knowledge is pessimistic, but my willing and hoping are optimistic.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Faithless “I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
author: Walt Disney

quote: A healthy attitude is contagious but don’t wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
author: Unknown

quote: In the hour of adversity, be not without hope; for crystal rain falls from black clouds.
author: Nizami

quote: I believed that no man in this world deserves me until I met you.
author: Luffina Lourduraj

quote: Cause all of me loves all of you. Love your curves and all your edges. All your perfect imperfections. Give your all to me, I’ll give my all to you. You’re my end and my beginning. Even when I lose I’m winning.
author: John Legend

quote: They say a good love is one that sits you down, gives you a drink of water, and pats you on top of the head. But I say a good love is one that casts you into the wind, sets you ablaze, makes you burn through the skies and ignite the night like a phoenix; the kind that cuts you loose like a wildfire and you can’t stop running simply because you keep on burning everything that you touch! I say that’s a good love; one that burns and flies, and you run with it!
author: C. JoyBell C.

quote: In love, all kinds of love, we wait. If I can’t be your dawn, I will be your sunset!
author: Rossana Condoleo

quote: In the end, you will not see the physical beauty in others that caught your eye, but the fire that burned within them. This kind of beauty is the bonfire you had to attend.
author: Shannon Alder

quote: Don’t love to be loved in return. Love for the sake of loving.
author: Connor Chalfant

quote: Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: I become a waterwheel, turning and tasting you, as long as water moves.
author: Rumi

quote: Love is a fire. But whether it is going to warm your heart or burn down your house, you can never tell!
author: Joan Crawford

quote: For you see, each day I love you more, Today more than yesterday and less than tomorrow.
author: Rosemonde Gerard

quote: Don’t just love a person for the image, idea or concept of them, but love them for every fantastically weird and twisted details that makes them up.
author: Lauren Klarfeld

quote: See there’s this place in me where your fingerprints still rest, your kisses still linger, and your whispers softly echo. It’s the place where a part of you will forever be a part of me.
author: Gretchen Kemp

quote: What I feel for you seems less of earth and more of a cloudless heaven.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: By loving all the parts of you that I dislike in myself, I am learning to love me too.
author: Kate McGahan

quote: One advantage of marriage it seems to me is that when you fall out of love with him or he falls out of love with you it keeps you together until maybe you fall in again.
author: Judith Viorst

quote: All I really need is love, but a little chocolate now and then doesn’t hurt!
author: Lucy Van Pelt

quote: I’m thinking of you, that’s all I do, all the time. You’re always the first and the last thing on this heart of mine. No matter where I go, or what I do, I’m thinking of you.
author: Dierks Bentley

quote: Sometimes your nearness takes my breath away; and all the things I want to say can find no voice. Then, in silence, I can only hope my eyes will speak my heart.
author: Robert Sexton

quote: What I do and what I dream include thee, as the wine must taste of its own grapes.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: I’ve learned that you can’t make someone love you. All you can do is stalk them and hope they’ll panic and give in.
author: Emo Philips

quote: I love being married. It’s so great to find one special person you want to annoy for the rest of your life.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: If you text ‘I love you’ to a person and the person writes back an emoji – no matter what that emoji is, they don’t love you back.
author: Chelsea Peretti

quote: Obviously, if I was serious about having a relationship with someone long-term, the last people I would introduce him to would be my family.
author: Chelsea Handler

quote: Never set limits when you are loving someone.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: It is an absolute human certainty that no one can know his own beauty or perceive a sense of his own worth until it has been reflected back to him in the mirror of another loving, caring human being.
author: John Joseph Powell

quote: The saddest thing is to be a minute to someone, when you’ve made them your eternity.
author: Sanober Khan

quote: Loving someone can be hard at times. You risk a lot when you love – your heart and soul, at the least. Love is the most important and most rewarding investment you can make in another person.
author: J.E.B. Spredemann

quote: I seem to have loved you in numberless forms, numberless times, in life after life, in age after age forever. – Rabindranath Tagore
author: Unknown

quote: The way sadness works is one of the strange riddles of the world. If you are stricken with a great sadness, you may feel as if you have been set aflame, not only because of the enormous pain but also because your sadness may spread over your life, like smoke from an enormous fire. – Lemony Snicket
author: Unknown

quote: Our sweetest songs are those that tell of saddest thought.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Sadness is but a wall between two gardens.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: Tears are words that need to be written.
author: Paulo Coelho

quote: We must understand that sadness is an ocean, and sometimes we drown, while other days we are forced to swim.
author: R.M. Drake

quote: There are moments when I wish I could roll back the clock and take all the sadness away, but I have the feeling that if I did, the joy would be gone as well.
author: Nicholas Sparks

quote: Experiencing sadness and anger can make you feel more creative, and by being creative you can get beyond your pain or negativity.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Some days are just bad days, that’s all. You have to experience sadness to know happiness, and I remind myself that not every day is going to be a good day, that’s just the way it is!.
author: Dita Von Teese

quote: Any fool can be happy. It takes a man with real heart to make beauty out of the stuff that makes us weep.
author: Clive Barker

quote: There is no point treating a depressed person as though she were just feeling sad, saying, ‘There now, hang on, you’ll get over it.’ Sadness is more or less like a head cold- with patience, it passes. Depression is like cancer.
author: Barbara Kingsolver

quote: There is no greater sorrow than to recall in misery the time when we were happy.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Depression is the most unpleasant thing I have ever experienced. . . . It is that absence of being able to envisage that you will ever be cheerful again. The absence of hope. That very deadened feeling, which is so very different from feeling sad. Sad hurts but it’s a healthy feeling. It is a necessary thing to feel. Depression is very different.
author: J.K. Rowling

quote: Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Sometimes we get sad about things and we don’t like to tell other people that we are sad about them. We like to keep it a secret. Or sometimes, we are sad but we really don’t know why we are sad, so we say we aren’t sad but we really are.
author: Mark Haddon

quote: Leaning against my father, the sadness finally broke open inside me, hollowing out my heart and leaving me bleeding. My feet felt rooted in the dirt. There were more than two bodies buried here. Pieces of me that I didn’t even know were under the ground. Pieces of dad, too.
author: Laurie Halse Anderson

quote: You cannot protect yourself from sadness without protecting yourself from happiness.
author: Jonathan Safran Foer

quote: The word ‘happy’ would lose its meaning if it were not balanced by sadness.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.
author: Jose N Harris

quote: The longer and more carefully we look at a funny story, the sadder it becomes.
author: Nikolai Gogol

quote: There is some kind of a sweet innocence in being human- in not having to be just happy or just sad- in the nature of being able to be both broken and whole, at the same time.
author: C. Joybell

quote: So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri

quote: The largest part of what we call ‘personality’ is determined by how we’ve opted to defend ourselves against anxiety and sadness.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: Every human walks around with a certain kind of sadness. They may not wear it on their sleeves, but it’s there if you look deep.
author: Taraji P. Henson

quote: Sadness gives depth. Happiness gives height. Sadness gives roots. Happiness gives branches. Happiness is like a tree going into the sky, and sadness is like the roots going down into the womb of the earth. Both are needed, and the higher a tree goes, the deeper it goes, simultaneously. The bigger the tree, the bigger will be its roots. In fact, it is always in proportion. That’s its balance.
author: Osho

quote: Don’t be ashamed to weep; ’tis right to grieve. Tears are only water, and flowers, trees, and fruit cannot grow without water. But there must be sunlight also. A wounded heart will heal in time, and when it does, the memory and love of our lost ones is sealed inside to comfort us.
author: Brian Jacques

quote: Tears are words the mouth can’t say nor can the heart bear.
author: Joshua Wisenbaker

quote: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
author: Nathaniel Branden

quote: A mother’s love for her child is like nothing else in the world. It knows no aw, no pity, it dares all things and crushes down remorselessly all that stands in its path.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Family quarrels are bitter things. They don’t go according to any rules. They’re not like aches or wounds, they’re more like splits in the skin that won’t heal because there’s not enough material.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: You can kiss your family and friends good-bye and put miles between you, but at the same time you carry them with you in your heart, your mind, your stomach, because you do not just live in a world but a world lives in you.
author: Frederick Buechner

quote: After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one’s own relations.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: When I was a boy of fourteen, my father was so ignorant I could hardly stand to have the old man around. But when I got to be twenty-one, I was astonished at how much the old man had learned in seven years.
author: Mark Twain

quote: No man has ever lived that had enough of children’s gratitude or woman’s love.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Family is the most important thing in the world.
author: Princess Diana

quote: When she can’t bring me to heal with scolding, she bends me to shape with guilt.
author: Libba Bray

quote: At the end of the day, a loving family should find everything forgivable.
author: Mark V. Olsen

quote: There’s nothing that makes you more insane than family. Or more happy. Or more exasperated. Or more… secure.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: Siblings: children of the same parents, each of whom is perfectly normal until they get together.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: Family means no one gets left behind or forgotten.
author: David Ogden Stiers

quote: A man travels the world over in search of what he needs, and returns home to find it.
author: George Moore

quote: When everything goes to hell, the people who stand by you without flinching – –  they are your family.
author: Jim Butcher

quote: All happy families are alike; each unhappy family is unhappy in its own way.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Govern a family as you would cook a small fish – very gently.
author: Chinese Proverb

quote: Spare the rod and spoil the child – that is true. But, beside the rod, keep an apple to give him when he has done well.
author: Martin Luther

quote: One day you will do things for me that you hate. That is what it means to be family.
author: Jonathan Foer

quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
author: John Bowring

quote: Family is not an important thing, it’s everything.
author: Michael J. Fox

quote: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Call it a clan, call it a network, call it a tribe, call it a family: Whatever you call it, whoever you are, you need one.
author: Jane Howard

quote: I think togetherness is a very important ingredient to family life.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: The bond that links your true family is not one of blood, but of respect and joy in each other’s life.
author: Richard Bach

quote: What can you do to promote world peace? Go home and love your family.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: My family comes first. Maybe that’s what makes me different from other guys.
author: Bobby Darin

quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close- knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: To understand your parents’ love, you must raise children yourself.
author: Chinese proverb

quote: The homemaker has the ultimate career. All other careers exist for one purpose only –  and that is to support the ultimate career.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: We do not develop habits of genuine love automatically. We learn by watching effective role models – most specifically by observing how our parents express love for each other day in and day out.
author: Josh McDowell

quote: Is this what family is like: the feeling that everyone’s connected, that with one piece missing, the whole thing’s broken?
author: Trenton Lee Stewart

quote: Writers will happen in the best of families.
author: Rita Mae Brown

quote: One’s family is the most important thing in life. I look at it this way: One of these days I’ll be over in a hospital somewhere with four walls around me. And the only people who’ll be with me will be my family.
author: Robert Byrd

quote: Family life is too intimate to be preserved by the spirit of justice. It can be sustained by a spirit of love which goes beyond justice.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The only rock I know that stays steady, the only institution I know that works, is the family.
author: Lee Iacocca

quote: we must take care of our families wherever we find them.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert

quote: All families are psychotic. Everybody has basically the same family –  it’s just reconfigured slightly different from one to the next.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: There is no such thing as fun for the whole family.
author: Jerry Seinfeld

quote: I sustain myself with the love of family.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: When trouble comes, it’s your family that supports you.
author: Guy Lafleur

quote: This was the trouble with families. Like invidious doctors, they knew just where it hurt.
author: Arundhati Roy

quote: Without a family, man, alone in the world, trembles with the cold.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.
author: Walt Disney

quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
author: Confucius

quote: He that raises a large family does, indeed, while he lives to observe them, stand a broader mark for sorrow; but then he stands a broader mark for pleasure too.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Cherish your human connections – your relationships with friends and family.
author: Barbara Bush

quote: Sticking with your family is what makes it a family.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: That’s what people do who love you. They put their arms around you and love you when you’re not so lovable.
author: Deb Caletti

quote: Home is where you are loved the most and act the worst.
author: Marjorie Pay Hinckley

quote: Strangers are just family you have yet to come to know.
author: Mitch Albom

quote: There’s nothing I value more than the closeness of friends and family, a smile as I pass someone on the street.
author: Willie Stargell

quote: Rejoice with your family in the beautiful land of life!
author: Albert Einstein

quote: No one’s family is normal. Normalcy is a lie invented by advertising agencies to make the rest of us feel inferior.
author: Calire LaZebnik

quote: You are born into your family and your family is born into you. No returns. No exchanges.
author: Elizabeth Berg

quote: Home is people. Not a place. If you go back there after the people are gone, then all you can see is what is not there any more.
author: Robin Hobb

quote: The wit of conversation consists more in finding it in others, than showing a great deal yourself. He who goes out of your company pleased with his own facetiousness and ingenuity, will the sooner come into it again.
author: Unknown

quote: If you would not be forgotten, as soon as you are dead and rotten, either write things worth reading, or do things worth the writing.
author: Unknown

quote: Be not sick too late, nor well too soon.
author: Unknown

quote: There are two ways of being happy — we may either diminish our wants or augment our means — either will do, the result is the same; and it is for each man to decide for himself, and do that which happens to be the easiest. If you are idle or sick or poor, however hard it may be to diminish your wants, it will be harder to augment your means.
author: Unknown

quote: If you are active and prosperous, or young, or in good health, it may be easier for you to augment your means than to diminish your wants. But if you are wise, you will do both at the same time, young or old, rich or poor, sick or well; and if you are wise, you will do both in such a way as to augment the general happiness of society.
author: Unknown

quote: Fear to do ill, and you need fear naught else.
author: Unknown

quote: An old young man will be a young old man.
author: Unknown

quote: Some, to make themselves considerable, pursue learning; others grasp at wealth; some aim at being thought witty; and others are only careful to make the most of a handsome person; but what is wit, or wealth, or form, or learning, when compared with virtue? It is true we love the handsome, we applaud the learned, and we fear the rich and powerful; but we even worship and adore the virtuous.
author: Unknown

quote: A learned blockhead is a greater blockhead than an ignorant one.
author: Unknown

quote: It is a common error in friends, when they would extol their friends, to make comparisons, and to depreciate the merits of others.
author: Unknown

quote: Each year one vicious habit rooted out, in time might make the worst man good throughout.
author: Unknown

quote: A new truth is a truth, an old error is an error.
author: Unknown

quote: A man of words and not of deeds, is like a garden full of weeds.
author: Unknown

quote: Having lived long, I have experienced many instances of being obliged by better information or fuller consideration to change opinions, even on important subjects, which I once thought right, but found to be otherwise.
author: Unknown

quote: The way to secure peace is to be prepared for war. They that are on their guard, and appear ready to receive their adversaries, are in much less danger of being attacked, than the supine, secure, and negligent.
author: Unknown

quote: A fat kitchen makes a lean will.
author: Unknown

quote: Don’t go to the doctor with every distemper, nor to the lawyer with every quarrel, nor to the pot for every thirst.
author: Unknown

quote: I never saw an oft-removed tree,  nor yet an oft-removed family,  that throve so well as those that settled be.
author: Unknown

quote: Glass, china, and reputation are easily cracked and never well mended.
author: Unknown

quote: An ounce of prevention is worth a pound of cure.
author: Unknown

quote: The worship of God is a duty; the hearing and reading of sermons may be useful; but if men rest in hearing and praying, as too many do, it is as if a tree should value itself in being watered and putting forth leaves, tho’ it never produced any fruit.
author: Unknown

quote: Eat to live, and not live to eat.
author: Unknown

quote: A great talker may be no fool, but he is one that relies on him.
author: Unknown

quote: When you incline to have new clothes, look first well over the old ones, and see if you cannot shift with them another year, either by scouring, mending, or even patching if necessary. Remember, a patch on your coat, and money in your pocket, is better and more creditable, than a writ on your back, and no money to take it off.
author: Unknown

quote: Lost time is never found again.
author: Unknown

quote: When there is so much to be done for yourself, your family, and your country, be up by peep of day! Let not the sun look down and say, ‘Inglorious here he lies!’
author: Unknown

quote: Don’t misinform your Doctor nor your Lawyer.
author: Unknown

quote: To expect people to be good, to be just, to be temperate, etc., without showing them how they should become so, seems like the ineffectual charity mentioned by the apostle, which consisted in saying to the hungry, the cold and the naked, be ye fed, be ye warmed, be ye clothed, without showing them how they should get food, fire or clothing.
author: Unknown

quote: He’s the best physician that knows the worthlessness of the most medicines.
author: Unknown

quote: Would you live with ease, do what you ought and not what you please.
author: Unknown

quote: Eat to please yourself, but dress to please others.
author: Unknown

quote: Man and woman have each of them qualities and tempers in which the other is deficient, and which in union contribute to the common felicity.
author: Unknown

quote: God heals, and the Doctor takes the Fees.
author: Unknown

quote: He that is known to pay punctually and exactly to the time he promises, may at any time, and on any occasion, raise all the money his friends can spare.
author: Unknown

quote: This is sometimes of great use.
author: Unknown

quote: When I am employed in serving others, I do not look upon myself as conferring favors, but as paying debts. I have received much kindness from men to whom I shall never have an opportunity of making the least direct returns; and numberless mercies from God, who is infinitely above being benefited by our services. Those kindnesses from men I can, therefore, only return on their fellow-men, and I can only show my gratitude for those mercies from God by a readiness to help His other children.
author: Unknown

quote: Early to bed and early to rise, makes a man healthy, wealthy, and wise.
author: Unknown

quote: Life, like a dramatic piece, should not only be conducted with regularity, but it should finish handsomely.
author: Unknown

quote: God helps them who help themselves.
author: Unknown

quote: Men are subject to various inconveniences merely through lack of a small share of courage, which is a quality very necessary in the common occurrences of life, as well as in a battle. How many impertinences do we daily suffer with great uneasiness, because we have not courage enough to discover our dislike.
author: Unknown

quote: The art of getting riches consists very much in thrift. All men are not equally qualified for getting money, but it is in the power of every one alike to practice this virtue.
author: Unknown

quote: If a sound body and a sound mind, which is as much as to say health and virtue, are to be preferred before all other considerations, ought not men, in choosing a business either for themselves or children, to refuse such as are unwholesome for the body, and such as make a man too dependent, too much obliged to please others, and too much subjected to their humors in order to be recommended and get a livelihood?
author: Unknown

quote: Our opinions are not in our own power; they are formed and governed much by circumstances that are often as inexplicable as they are irresistible.
author: Unknown

quote: Tricks and treachery are the practice of fools, that don’t have brains enough to be honest.
author: Unknown

quote: After all, wedlock is the natural state of man. A bachelor is not a complete human being. He is like the odd half of a pair of scissors, which has not yet found its fellow, and therefore is not even half so useful as they might be together.
author: Unknown

quote: A penny saved is a penny earned.
author: Unknown

quote: I would advise you to read with a pen in hand, and enter in a little book short hints of what you find that is curious, or that may be useful; for this will be the best method of imprinting such particulars in your memory.
author: Unknown

quote: By the collision of different sentiments, sparks of truth are struck out, and political light is obtained. The different factions, which at present divide us, aim all at the public good; the differences are only about the various modes of promoting it.
author: Unknown

quote: Reading makes a full man, meditation a profound man, discourse a clear man.
author: Unknown

quote: There are in life real evils enough, and it is folly to afflict ourselves with imaginary ones; it is time enough when the real ones arrive.
author: Unknown

quote: ‘You may delay, but time will not.
author: Unknown

quote: Work as if you were to live a hundred years. Pray as if you were to die tomorrow.
author: Unknown

quote: Hope and faith may be more firmly built upon charity, than charity upon faith and hope.
author: Unknown

quote: If a man empties his purse into his head, no man can take it away from him. An investment in knowledge always pays the best interest.
author: Unknown

quote: One today is worth two tomorrows.
author: Unknown

quote: I look upon death to be as necessary to our constitution as sleep.
author: Unknown

quote: Life’s tragedy is that we get old too soon and wise too late.
author: Unknown

quote: We shall rise refreshed in the morning.
author: Unknown

quote: We need a revolution every 200 years, because all governments become stale and corrupt after 200 years.
author: Unknown

quote: The best thing to give to your enemy is forgiveness; to an opponent, tolerance; to a friend, your heart; to your child, a good example; to a father, deference; to your mother, conduct that will make her proud of you; to yourself, respect; to all others, charity.
author: Unknown

quote: Security without liberty is called prison.
author: Unknown

quote: The best of all medicines are rest and fasting.
author: Unknown

quote: When you’re finished changing, you’re finished.
author: Unknown

quote: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Unknown

quote: It seems to me, that if statesmen had a little more arithmetic, or were accustomed to calculation, wars would be much less frequent.
author: Unknown

quote: The most trifling actions of a man, in my opinion, as well as the smallest features and lineaments of the face give a nice observer some notion of his mind.
author: Unknown

quote: He who sacrifices freedom for security deserves neither.
author: Unknown

quote: I never knew a man who was good at making excuses who was good at anything else.
author: Unknown

quote: Common sense is something that everyone needs, few have, and none think they lack.
author: Unknown

quote: Rather go to bed without dinner than to rise in debt.
author: Unknown

quote: Most men die from the neck up at age twenty-five because they stop dreaming.
author: Unknown

quote: The ancients tell us what is best; but we must learn of the moderns what is fittest.
author: Unknown

quote: I don’t believe in stereotypes. I prefer to hate people on a more personal basis.
author: Unknown

quote: To lengthen thy Life, lessen thy Meals.
author: Unknown

quote: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
author: Unknown

quote: He that is of the opinion money will do everything may well be suspected of doing everything for money.
author: Unknown

quote: Content makes poor men rich; discontentment makes rich men poor.
author: Unknown

quote: Employ your time well, if you mean to get leisure.
author: Unknown

quote: Well done is better than well said.
author: Unknown

quote: Energy and persistence conquer all things.
author: Unknown

quote: If you would know the value of money, go try to borrow some; for he that goes a-borrowing goes a-sorrowing.
author: Unknown

quote: If you would persuade, you must appeal to interest rather than intellect.
author: Unknown

quote: The eye of the master will do more work than both his hands.
author: Unknown

quote: Creditors have better memories than debtors.
author: Unknown

quote: Hide not your talents, they for use were made. What’s a sun-dial in the shade?
author: Unknown

quote: When the well’s dry, we know the worth of water.
author: Unknown

quote: To the generous mind the heaviest debt is that of gratitude, when it is not in our power to repay it.
author: Unknown

quote: A brother may not be a friend, but a friend will always be a brother.
author: Unknown

quote: It is the working man who is the happy man. It is the idle man who is the miserable man.
author: Unknown

quote: Words may show a man’s wit but actions his meaning.
author: Unknown

quote: There is much difference between imitating a man and counterfeiting him.
author: Unknown

quote: If you know how to spend less than you get, you have the philosopher’s stone.
author: Unknown

quote: No nation was ever ruined by trade.
author: Unknown

quote: Happiness consists more in small conveniences or pleasures that occur every day, than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom to a man in the course of his life.
author: Unknown

quote: Speak ill of no man, but speak all the good you know of everybody.
author: Unknown

quote: Educate your children to self-control, to the habit of holding passion and prejudice and evil tendencies subject to an upright and reasoning will, and you have done much to abolish misery from their future and crimes from society.
author: Unknown

quote: There are three things extremely hard: steel, a diamond, and to know one’s self.
author: Unknown

quote: Where liberty is, there is my country.
author: Unknown

quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Unknown

quote: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
author: Unknown

quote: To be content, look backward on those who possess less than yourself, not forward on those who possess more. If this does not make you content, you don’t deserve to be happy.
author: Unknown

quote: He that falls in love with himself, will have no Rivals.
author: Unknown

quote: Wink at small faults; remember thou hast great ones.
author: Unknown

quote: Necessity never made a good bargain.
author: Unknown

quote: In this world nothing can be said to be certain, except death and taxes.
author: Unknown

quote: The way to be safe, is never to be secure.
author: Unknown

quote: Without continual growth and progress, such words as improvement, achievement, and success have no meaning.
author: Unknown

quote: Beware of little expenses. A small leak will sink a great ship.
author: Unknown

quote: The Constitution only gives people the right to pursue happiness. You have to catch it yourself.
author: Unknown

quote: To succeed, jump as quickly at opportunities as you do at conclusions.
author: Unknown

quote: Be studious in your profession, and you will be learned. Be industrious and frugal and you will be rich. Be sober and temperate and you will be healthy. Be in general virtuous and you will be happy.
author: Unknown

quote: Those that won’t be counseled can’t be helped.
author: Unknown

quote: Quotes About Benjamin Franklin
author: Unknown

quote: People will accept your idea much more readily if you tell them Benjamin Franklin said it first.
author: David H. Comins

quote: My ideal man is Benjamin Franklin—the figure in American history most worthy of emulation. Franklin is my ideal of a whole man. Where are the life-size—or even pint-size—Benjamin Franklins of today?
author: Isidor Isaac Rabi

quote: When Franklin drew the lightning from the clouds, he little dreamed that in the evolution of science his discovery would illuminate the torch of Liberty for France and America. The rays from this beacon, lighting this gateway to the continent, will welcome the poor and the persecuted with the hope and promise of homes and citizenship.
author: Chauncey Depew

quote: As an answer to those who are in the habit of saying to every new fact, “What is its use?” Dr. Franklin says to such, “What is the use of an infant?” The answer of the experimentalist would be, “Endeavour to make it useful.
author: ” -Michael Faraday

quote: Whilst I am writing to a Philosopher and a Friend, I can scarcely forget that I am also writing to the greatest Statesman of the present, or perhaps of any century, who spread the happy contagion of Liberty among his countrymen.
author: Erasmus Darwin, Letter to Benjamin Franklin

quote: Sometimes you don’t realize your own strength until you come face to face with your greatest weakness.
author: Susan Gale

quote: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: True strength is keeping everything together when everyone expects you to fall apart.
author: Unknown

quote: Anyone can give up, it’s the easiest thing in the world to do. But to hold it together when everyone else would understand if you fell apart, that’s true strength.
author: Unknown

quote: The most beautiful people I’ve known are those who have known trials, have known struggles, have known loss, and have found their way out of the depths.
author: Elisabeth Kübler-Ross

quote: You never know how strong you are… until being strong is the only choice you have.
author: Cayla Mills

quote: Fall down seven times, get up eight.
author: Japanese Proverb

quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says ‘I’m possible’!
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Dream as if you’ll live forever, live as if you’ll die today.
author: James Dean

quote: Anyone can hide. Facing up to things, working through them, that’s what makes you strong.
author: Sarah Dessen

quote: Courage is looking fear right in the eye and saying, ‘Get the hell out of my way, I’ve got things to do.'
author: Unknown

quote: Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won’t either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could.
author: Louise Erdrich

quote: The world breaks everyone, and afterward, some are strong at the broken places.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle. And so we must straighten our backs and work for our freedom. A man can’t ride you unless your back is bent.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Nobody can hurt me without my permission.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A heart is a muscle..and what do muscles do when they are torn? They grow back STRONGER!
author: Unknown
