quote: The last three or four reps is what makes the muscle grow. This area of pain divides the champion from someone else who is not a champion. That’s what most people lack, having the guts to go on and just say they’ll go through the pain no matter what happens.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote: Talents are best nurtured in solitude, but character is best formed in the stormy billows of the world.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Character isn’t something you were born with and can’t change, like your fingerprints. It’s something you weren’t born with and must take responsibility for forming.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Character, in the long run, is the decisive factor in the life of an individual and of nations alike.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: I have no regrets in my life. I think that everything happens to you for a reason. The hard times that you go through build character, making you a much stronger person.
author: Rita Mero

quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person’s character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself one.
author: James A. Froude

quote: Sow a thought, and you reap an act; Sow an act, and you reap a habit; Sow a habit, and you reap a character; Sow a character, and you reap a destiny.
author: Charles Reade

quote: The depth and strength of a human character are defined by its moral reserves. People reveal themselves completely only when they are thrown out of the customary conditions of their life, for only then do they have to fall back on their reserves.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The measure of a man’s real character is what he would do if he knew he would never be found out.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: The resistance that you fight physically in the gym and the resistance that you fight in life can only build a strong character.
author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

quote:
Watch your thoughts, for they become words.
Watch your words, for they become actions.
Watch your actions, for they become habits.
Watch your habits, for they become character.
Watch your character, for it becomes your destiny.
author: Author Unknown

quote: It’s hard to beat a person who never gives up.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: If passion drives you, let reason hold the reins.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: I’m a greater believer in luck, and I find the harder I work the more I have of it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: I have learned that real angels don’t have gossamer white robes and Cherubic skin, they have calloused hands and smell of the days’ sweat.
author: Richard Evans

quote: Greatness is sifted through the grind, therefore don’t despise the hard work now for surely it will be worth it in the end.
author: Sanjo Jendayi

quote: A dream doesn’t become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
author: Colin Powell

quote: My grandfather once told me that there were two kinds of people: those who do the work and those who take the credit. He told me to try to be in the first group; there was much less competition.
author: Indira Gandhi

quote: Happiness is the real sense of fulfillment that comes from hard work.
author: Joseph Barbara

quote: Hard work keeps the wrinkles out of the mind and spirit.
author: Helena Rubinstein

quote: No great achiever – even those who made it seem easy – ever succeeded without hard work.
author: Jonathan Sacks

quote: Hard work helps. It has never killed anyone.
author: Unknown

quote: The highest reward for man’s toil is not what he gets for it, but what he becomes by it.
author: John Ruskin

quote: You learn the value of hard work by working hard.
author: Unknown

quote: Nobody’s a natural. You work hard to get good and then work to get better. It’s hard to stay on top.
author: Paul Coffey

quote: Don’t wish it were easier. Wish you were better.
author: Jim Rohn

quote: All growth depends upon activity. There is no development physically or intellectually without effort, and effort means work.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Talent means nothing, while experience, acquired in humility and with hard work, means everything.
author: Patrick Suskind

quote: The difference between ordinary and extraordinary is that little extra.
author: Jimmy Johnson

quote: If I told you I’ve worked hard to get where I’m at, I’d be lying, because I have no idea where I am right now.
author: Jarod Kintz

quote: Too many irons, not enough fire.
author: S. Kelley Harrell

quote: Patience can be bitter but her fruit is always sweet.
author: Habeeb Akande

quote: If you don’t burn out at the end of each day, you’re a bum.
author: George Lois

quote: If you try and lose then it isn’t your fault. But if you don’t try and we lose, then it’s all your fault.
author: Orson Scott Card

quote: Embrace the pain to inherit the gain.
author: Habeeb Akande

quote: Talent is what God gives us, Skill is what we give back to Him.
author: Eliel Pierre

quote: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work.
author: Harry Golden

quote: I hope the millions of people I’ve touched have the optimism and desire to share their goals and hard work and persevere with a positive attitude.
author: Michael Jordan

quote: Goodness and hard work are rewarded with respect.
author: Luther Campbell

quote: Everything yields to diligence.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: When I meet succesful people I ask about 100 questions to find out who they attribute their success to. It is usually the same: persistence, hard work and hiring good people.
author: Kiana Tom

quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goals: my strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: I don’t have a blue-collar job. It’s more of a green collar, because of all the yellow sweat stains mixing in.
author: Jarod Kintz

quote: No one ever drowned in sweat.
author: USMC Officer

quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: If your dream is a big dream, and if you want your life to work on the high level that you say you do, there’s no way around doing the work it takes to get you there.
author: Joyce Chapman

quote: I do not care about happiness simply because I believe that joy is something worth fighting for.
author: Criss Jami

quote: Hard work without talent is a shame, but talent without hard work is a tragedy.
author: Robert Hall

quote: A clay pot sitting in the sun will always be a clay pot. It has to go through the white heat of the furnace to become porcelain.
author: Mildred Struven

quote: You were hired because you met expectations, you will be promoted if you can exceed them.
author: Saji Ijiyemi

quote: Inspiration is the windfall from hard work and focus. Muses are too unreliable to keep on the payroll.
author: Helen Hanson

quote: There are no shortcuts to any place worth going.
author: Beverly Sills

quote: Do the things you like to be happier, stronger & more successful. Only so is hard work replaced by dedication.
author: Rossana Condoleo

quote: Only cooked time tastes well.
author: Dr. Zeeshan Ahmed

quote: Nothing in life comes easy.
author: Unknown

quote: Change is hard work.
author: Billy Crystal

quote: Once you have commitment, you need the discipline and hard work to get you there.
author: Haile Gebrselassie

quote: Sometimes it takes a lowly, title-less man to humble the world. Kings, rulers, CEOs, judges, doctors, pastors, they are already expected to be greater and wiser.
author: Criss Jami

quote: Work hard and be patient. The rest will follow.
author: Unknown

quote: Start by doing what’s necessary, then what’s possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
author: Saint Francis

quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one’s ignorance.
author: Unknown

quote: The perfecting of one’s self is the fundamental base of all progress and all moral development.
author: Confucius

quote: He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good.
author: Unknown

quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
author: Unknown

quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Unknown

quote: If I am walking with two other men, each of them will serve as my teacher. I will pick out the good points of the one and imitate them, and the bad points of the other and correct them in myself.
author: Unknown

quote: He that would perfect his work must first sharpen his tools.
author: Unknown

quote: Virtue is more to man than either water or fire. I have seen men die from treading on water and fire, but I have never seen a man die from treading the course of virtue.
author: Unknown

quote: Be not ashamed of mistakes and thus make them crimes.
author: Unknown

quote: Isn’t it a pleasure to study and practice what you have learned?
author: Unknown

quote: Isn’t it also great when friends visit from distant places? If one remains not annoyed when he is not understood by people around him, isn’t he a sage?
author: Unknown

quote: It is not possible for one to teach others who cannot teach his own family.
author: Unknown

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: Education breeds confidence. Confidence breeds hope. Hope breeds peace.
author: Unknown

quote: Without feelings of respect, what is there to distinguish men from beasts?
author: Unknown

quote: It is not possible for one to teach others who cannot teach his own family.He who excels in study can follow an official career.
author: Unknown

quote: He who excels in study can follow an official career.
author: Unknown

quote: Forget injuries, never forget kindnesses.
author: Unknown

quote: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
author: Confucius

quote: We should feel sorrow, but not sink under its oppression.
author: Unknown

quote: Recompense injury with justice, and recompense kindness with kindness.
author: Unknown

quote: Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without.
author: Unknown

quote: To love a thing means wanting it to live.
author: Unknown

quote: To go beyond is as wrong as to fall short.
author: Unknown

quote: The gem cannot be polished without friction, nor man perfected without trial.
author: Confucius

quote: In a country well governed poverty is something to be ashamed of.
author: Unknown

quote: Things that are done, it is needless to speak about…things that are past, it is needless to blame.
author: Unknown

quote: Learn as though you would never be able to master it; hold it as though you would be in fear of losing it.
author: Unknown

quote: Do not be desirous of having things done quickly. Do not look at small advantages. Desire to have things done quickly prevents their being done thoroughly.
author: Unknown

quote: If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed; if in terms of ten years, plant trees; if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.
author: Confucius

quote: Looking at small advantages prevents great affairs from being accomplished.
author: Unknown

quote: The people may be made to follow a path of action, but they may not be made to understand it.
author: Unknown

quote: When you have faults, do not fear to abandon them.
author: Unknown

quote: The cautious seldom err.
author: Unknown

quote: The superior man is modest in his speech, but excels in his actions.
author: Confucius

quote: Men’s natures are alike, it is their habits that carry them far apart.
author: Unknown

quote: It is only the wisest and the stupidest that cannot change.
author: Unknown

quote: The object of the superior man is truth.
author: Unknown

quote: The essence of knowledge is, having it, to apply it not having it, to confess your ignorance.
author: Unknown

quote: A man who does not plan long ahead will find trouble right at his door.
author: Unknown

quote: Silence is the true friend that never betrays.
author: Confucius

quote: Humility is the solid foundation of all the virtues.
author: Unknown

quote: With coarse rice to eat, with water to drink, and my bended arm for a pillow – I have still joy in the midst of these things. Riches and honors acquired by unrighteousness are to me as a floating cloud.
author: Unknown

quote: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
author: Unknown

quote: Study the past if you would define the future.
author: Unknown

quote: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Confucius

quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Unknown

quote: The scholar who cherishes the love of comfort is not fit to be deemed a scholar.
author: Unknown

quote: Wheresoever you go, go with all your heart.
author: Unknown

quote: The real fault is to have faults and not amend them.
author: Unknown

quote: When we see men of a contrary character, we should turn inwards and examine ourselves.
author: Unknown

quote: It does not matter how slowly you go, so long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quote: He with whom neither slander that gradually soaks into the mind, nor statements that startle like a wound in the flesh, are successful may be called intelligent indeed.
author: Unknown

quote: The faults of a superior person are like the sun and moon. They have their faults, and everyone sees them; they change and everyone looks up to them.
author: Unknown

quote: A fool despises good counsel, but a wise man takes it to heart.
author: Unknown

quote: He who will not economize will have to agonize.
author: Unknown

quote: Success depends upon previous preparation, and without such preparation there is sure to be failure.
author: Confucius

quote: I am not concerned that I am not known, I seek to be worthy to be known.
author: Unknown

quote: They must change who would be constant in happiness and wisdom.
author: Unknown

quote: Without an acquaintance with the rules of propriety, it is impossible for the character to be established.
author: Unknown

quote: Mankind differs from the animals only by a little and most people throw that away.
author: Unknown

quote: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don’t adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
author: Confucius

quote: To see what is right, and not to do it, is want of courage or of principle.
author: Unknown

quote: It is better to light one small candle than to curse the darkness.
author: Unknown

quote: Respect yourself and others will respect you.
author: Unknown

quote: When prosperity comes, do not use all of it.
author: Unknown

quote: Do not use a cannon to kill a mosquito.
author: Confucius

quote: Ignorance is the night of the mind, but a night without moon and star.
author: Unknown

quote: I am not one who was born in the possession of knowledge; I am one who is fond of antiquity, and earnest in seeking it there.
author: Unknown

quote: They must often change who would be constant in happiness or wisdom.
author: Unknown

quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Unknown

quote: Our greatest glory is not in never falling but in rising every time we fall.
author: Confucius

quote: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it; and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it – this is knowledge.
author: Unknown

quote: We take greater pains to persuade others that we are happy than in endeavoring to think so ourselves.
author: Unknown

quote: To put the world in order, we must first put the nation in order; to put the nation in order, we must put the family in order; to put the family in order, we must cultivate our personal life; and to cultivate our personal life, we must first set our hearts right.
author: Unknown

quote: Music produces a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without.
author: Confucius

quote: To be able to practice five things everywhere under heaven constitutes perfect virtue…They are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness, and kindness.
author: Unknown

quote: If a man takes no thought about what is distant, he will find sorrow near at hand.
author: Unknown

quote: Behave toward everyone as if receiving a great guest.
author: Unknown

quote: What the superior man seeks is in himself; what the small man seeks is in others.
author: Unknown

quote: The firm, the enduring, the simple, and the modest are near to virtue.
author: Confucius

quote: The strength of a nation derives from the integrity of the home.
author: Unknown

quote: There are three things to beware of through life: when a man is young, let him beware of his appetites; when he is middle-aged, of his passions; and when old, of covetousness, especially.
author: Unknown

quote: When you see a worthy person, endeavor to emulate him. When you see an unworthy person, then examine your inner self.
author: Unknown

quote: When a man’s knowledge is sufficient to attain, and his virtue is not sufficient to enable him to hold, whatever he may have gained, he will lose again.
author: Unknown

quote: Have no friends not equal to yourself.
author: Confucius

quote: Wealth and rank are what people desire, but unless they be obtained in the right way they may not be possessed.
author: Unknown

quote: The wheel of fortune turns round incessantly, and who can say to himself, I shall today be uppermost.
author: Unknown

quote: The father who does not teach his son his duties is equally guilty with the son who neglects them.
author: Unknown

quote: The parents age must be remembered, both for joy and anxiety.
author: Unknown

quote: When I walk along with two others, from at least one I will be able to learn.
author: Unknown

quote: Faithfulness and sincerity are the highest things.
author: Confucius

quote: If you look into your own heart, you find nothing wrong there, what is there to fear?
author: Unknown

quote: Study the past if you would divine the future.
author: Unknown

quote: Virtue is not left to stand alone. He who practices it will have neighbors.
author: Unknown

quote: Think no vice so small that you may commit it, and no virtue so small that you may over look it.
author: Unknown

quote: Without knowing the force of words, it is impossible to know men.
author: Confucius

quote: Do not worry about holding high position; worry rather about playing your proper role.
author: Unknown

quote: Do not impose on others what you yourself do not desire.
author: Unknown

quote: Acquire new knowledge whilst thinking over the old, and you may become a teacher of others.
author: Unknown

quote: Sincerity and truth are the basis of every virtue.
author: Unknown

quote: Review the old and deducing the new makes a teacher.
author: Unknown

quote: A man who has committed a mistake and doesn’t correct it is committing another mistake.
author: Confucius

quote: Act with kindness, but do not expect gratitude.
author: Unknown

quote: Worry not that no one knows of you; seek to be worth knowing.
author: Unknown

quote: He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
author: Unknown

quote: Ability will never catch up with the demand for it.
author: Unknown

quote: To see and listen to the wicked is already the beginning of wickedness.
author: Unknown

quote: Before you embark on a journey of revenge, dig two graves.
author: Unknown

quote: A youth is to be regarded with respect. How do you know that his future will not be equal to our present?
author: Unknown

quote: A common man marvels at uncommon things. A wise man marvels at the commonplace.
author: Unknown

quote: Fix your mind on truth, hold firm to virtue, rely on loving kindness, and find your recreation in the Arts.
author: Unknown

quote: Boldness, without the rules of propriety, becomes insubordination.
author: Unknown

quote: To be able under all circumstances to practice five things constitutes perfect virtue; these five things are gravity, generosity of soul, sincerity, earnestness and kindness.
author: Unknown

quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue.
author: Unknown

quote: The will to win, the desire to succeed, the urge to reach your full potential… these are the keys that will unlock the door to personal excellence.
author: Unknown

quote: We hope these Confucius quotes put you on a virtuous path! Let us know if there are any of your favorites that we missed!
author: Unknown
